dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: A line of PASSENGERS about to board a Pan Am flight to  London. JACK CAMPBELL, 22, head full of long unkempt hair, Tom  Selleck mustache,  the hopeful look of youth in his  eyes... sitting next to... KATE REYNOLDS, 21, pretty, Dorothy Hamill haircut... rubbing the tears from  her swollen red eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you a few necessities...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate hands Jack a new copy of VonnegutВ’s В“CatВ’s  Cradle.В” KATE  (CONTВ’D) Your copy was a mess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack accepts the book but heВ’s unable to take his eyes  off Kate.  She hands him a cassette. KATE (CONTВ’D) Every one of these songs will  remind you of me in a slightly  different way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All in one tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also put side two of London  Calling on there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate leans over and kisses him passionately on the  lips. KATE  (CONTВ’D) That was not officially the  goodbye kiss. It was just an  interim kiss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her, his eyes welling up. He pulls her  close, kissing her deeply. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will be the final boarding  call for Pan Am flight 4 to  London, Heathrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack takes KateВ’s hand, getting up, turning sadly to  the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have your ticket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pulls out a BLUE PAN AM TICKET ENVELOPE.  Kate  nods. They embrace and kiss again.  As they separate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m not even gonna say it,  Kate. Maybe itВ’ll be like  I never left...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack takes one lastlook at her, then heads for the  gate. Kate stands there, watching him go.  Then... ...a  moment of intuition. Something isnВ’t right. She  looks at Jack, about to disappear into the jetway,  trying to decide...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack turns. Kate approaches him. KATE (CONTВ’D) I have a bad feeling about  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the plane? What do you  think itВ’s gonna crash? DonВ’t  say that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) I know weВ’ve talked about this a  thousand times and we both agree  that going to London is the  right thing to do. But in my  heart... this feels wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the gate...the last few passengers are board then back into JackВ’s eyes. KATE (CONTВ’D) DonВ’t  go, Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean donВ’t go at all?   What about my internship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me I know what an  incredible opportunity this  is for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For us, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, for us. But...IВ’m afraid that if you get on  that plane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks at him, pleading with her eyes, but she canВ’t say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (torn) Go. IВ’m sorry, you should just  go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking, then...) No, youВ’re right.  What are we  doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're being responsible.  Go. Get on the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes narrow as he measures her determination...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a smile) Get the hell outta my sight. You bother me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A laugh from Jack.  Kate gives him a calm smile and a nod - it's not entirely convincing but it's enough for Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resolute) Okay, I'm going...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her in his arms one last time and hugs her tight.  Jack looks toward the gate, the line disappearing...Kate grasps his shirt tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't seem to let go of you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me complaining about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sober look in Jack's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we're at the airport and no one ever thinks clearly at the airport so we should just trust the decision we already made.  You've been accepted to one of the best law schools in the country, I've got this internship at Barclay's Bank. We have a great plan, honey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate nods, then, with resolve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to do something great, Jack?  Let's flush the plan...start our lives right now, today...I don't know what that life's gonna look like but I do know it has both of us in it.  And I choose us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is jolted by her words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plan doesn't make us great, Jack.  What we have together, that's what makes us great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her words sink in...A long moment of decision...He looks toward the gate, only one person left in line...back to Kate...imploring him with her eyes. Finally...He kisses her deeply on the lips...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Kate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a smile from Kate...relief...then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking her face in his hands) ...and a year in London's not gonna change that.  A hundred years couldn't change that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack gives her one final kiss then walks pensively to the gate, handing the attendant his ticket, not able to look back. Kate watches him go, tears streaming down her face, as the gate door closes behind him.  She waits, almost willing it to open again...waiting...waiting...but it doesn't...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The skating rink at Central Park...Christmas tree at Rockefeller Center...the view down Fifth Avenue with Christmas decorations...Park Avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We close in on a spectacular pre-war doorman building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge space with gleaming hardwood floors, ornate moldings, and a great view of the Hudson and Jersey behind it... The place looks like a museum display...everything is of the highest quality and meticulously maintained. A wall of photos - Jack and Clinton, Jack with Patrick Ewing, Jack between Alan Greenspan and Henry Kravis. And a "Willie Mays" baseball bat encased in glass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...impeccably decorated and obsessively neat. Close in on the bed where JACK CAMPBELL, now 35, sans mustache and long hair, opens his eyes. A FLASH of bright morning light from the window.  Jack shields his eyes, turning his head toward the bathroom where he sees... A WOMAN'S BACK...draped in a towel...an incredible back, neither flabby nor overly toned, beautifully curved...Jack focuses on it a moment. As the woman turns to him... PAULA.  Beautiful, late 20s, a toothbrush in her mouth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up toothbrush) I hope you don't mind.  There were like ten new ones in the cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A playful smile from Paula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what you think.  I took Mentadent public...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula smiles, moves over to a chair and grabs a little black dress hanging neatly over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you really mean what you said about Tuscany?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night was great...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are an amazing lover.  You should be giving motivational seminars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  You're not bad yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack grabs his Frank Mueller watch from the night stand, puts it on his wrist.  He looks at Paula as she slips the dress on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like that, too. JACK Tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Christmas Eve, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we'll get egg nog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting on her shoes) I have to go to my parents' house out in Jersey.  Would you like to come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jersey?  You know what the traffic's gonna be like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking the train...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula approaches Jack, leaning over him, her long hair dangling on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have anywhere to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got plenty of places to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stays there, confident, sexy, waiting for an answer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a sexy laugh, then...) Maybe I can try and sneak away some time tomorrow morning... (kissing him on  the lips) Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coy) If it's something you feel strongly about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula walks to the door, then turns back to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nice meeting you, Jack...

dialogues.speaker: CHAPTER TWO
dialogues.text: 4A        INT. JACKВ’S APARTMENT - MORNING Jack saunters over to a Yamaha Grand Disclavier in the  living room.  He puts a disk into the piano and... ...the keys come alive with the music of BACH.  Jack  hits a switch and suddenly the entire apartment is  enveloped in music... 4B        INT. JACKВ’S BUILDING, CORRIDOR - SAME TIME Paula, waiting for the elevator, hears the MUSIC  emanating from JackВ’s apartment...an intrigued glance  back at the apartment door as the elevator arrives... 5        INT. JACKВ’S BATHROOM - MORNING BackВ’s В“Passion According to St. MatthewВ” is blaring  through the speakers, the music is swelling to full  orchestra... JackВ’s at the mirror in this incredibly neat marble- tiled bathroom, shaving with a silver-plated Hammacher  Schlemmer razor, HUMMING with the orchestra... 6        INT. JACKВ’S CLOSET - MORNING ...the size of a small house, a long row of Zegna  suits, shoe trees stacked with Italian shoes, tailored  shirts everywhere. JackВ’s still HUMMING to the music as he dresses in  front of a mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, wearing an elegant camelВ’s hair overcoat and  carrying a leather briefcase, a В“Master of the  UniverseВ” smile on his face, now HUMMING the Bach piece  from memory... The doors open at 6.  Jack self-consciously stops  singing as ELIZABETH PETERSON, 60s, wearing a mink  coat, gets on the elevator carrying a yappy little dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a charming smile) Mrs. Peterson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Jack.  You donВ’t  have to stop singing on  my account...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s because IВ’m shy,  Betty.  So, when are you  going to leave that old  corpse Mr. Peterson and  run away with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you could never  satisfy me the way he  does...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open to the lobby.  Mrs. Peterson walks out  ahead. 8        INT. JACKВ’S BUILDING, LOBBY - MORNING TONY THE DOORMAN holds the door open for Jack and Mrs.  Peterson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, Mr.  Campbell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HowВ’d you do this year,  Tony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About four grand.  And a  bottle of twenty five  year old scotch from Mrs.  Johnson in 9D.  IВ’m  putting it all in  commercial paper like you  said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just until the Deutsche  Mark turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack exits the building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s Ferrari racing through the park...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modern Wall Street building.  The sign above the  glass doors reads, В“P.K. Lassiter and Associates,  Investment House.В” The Ferrari SCREECHES to a halt.  Jack gets out, heads  into the building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Jack throws his keys to a nearby SECURITY GUARD with a smile on his way to the elevators...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Manhattan skyline shines through the windows of this beautiful conference room. SIX EXECUTIVES are seated at a huge oak table littered with coffee cups and lunch waste.  At the end of the table, ALAN MINTZ, 30s, balding, sits with a faraway look in his eyes, three empty Diet Coke cans in front of him. Mintz is poking at a shiny gold cherub dangling from a small, plastic Christmas tree, sitting in the middle of the table. Jack is addressing the group from the front of the room, standing in front of a computer with a huge flat screen monitor, covered with stock charts and tables...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...if MedTech's shares sink any lower than... (casually executing  a keystroke) ...forty three, we're in trouble with the stock valuation.  So for god's sake watch what you say to your institutional customers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack notices Alan Mintz playing with the cherub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we still have almost a full day of trading before zero hour and I don't want any trouble... (distracted by Mintz) ...penny for your thoughts, Alan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Jack.  I told Dee and the kids I'd be home by dinner.  You know, it being Christmas Eve and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LAUGH from the group.  Jack approaches Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I like being here on Christmas Eve, Alan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another LAUGH.  Even Jack lets out a good-natured chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, maybe I do have a touch of tunnel vision this holiday season.  But in two days we're going to announce one of the largest mergers in U.S. corporate history.  Thirty billion dollars... (basking in the glory) When this kind of deal turns up you get on and you ride it `till it's over.  You don't ask it for a vacation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chuckle from the group...the esprit de corps seems to energize Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the group) December 26th.  After that there'll be so much money floating around here it'll be like Christmas every day... (smiling) December 26th, people.  If you'd like to celebrate that day, you all have my blessing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enthusiastic nods and words of agreement from the suits around the table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, Jack.  Sorry... Jack approaches Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to be sorry, Alan, I want you to be excited.  I want my gift to be the first one you open this year.  You know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because my gift comes with ten zeroes at the end...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MURMUR of excitement in the room, even Alan cracks a smile.  Jack puts a hand on Alan's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conference room door opens and the SIX ENERGIZED SUITS emerge, each met by an ASSISTANT handing them messages. Jack is the last one out.  He's met in stride by ADELLE, 50s, carrying a Filofax and a pile of phone messages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only eight thirty?  What's the matter, had some last minute shopping to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pops a peppermint Lifesaver in his mouth as Adelle hands him his messages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too?  This holiday's about giving, Adelle.  And I'm giving everything I've got to this deal, so in a way, I'm more Christmassy than anyone... (holding out the candy) Lifesaver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring the candy) You're a ray of sunshine, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach an office, the words, "Jack Campbell - President" stenciled on the glass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...continuing past Adelle's desk, Jack looking at his messages, and into Jack's office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cavernous office, you could land a helicopter in it - high tech fixtures, full bar, leather sofa, $3,000 Stairmaster... Jack walks to an enormous, bare mahogany desk, and sits down in a high tech ergonomic leather chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and Oxxford called...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, my suits are ready...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets to the last message, sees the name on it, and reels back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate Reynolds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her assistant said you could call her at home after eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stares at the message like he's looking at a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her assistant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah Jack, her assistant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lost in the message) Kate Reynolds was my girlfriend in college.  I almost married her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a hearty LAUGH) You?  Married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping out of it) Almost married.  And almost a junior broker at E.F. Hutton...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't want me to go to London.  We're standing at the airport saying goodbye and she asks me to stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you left her?  Just like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, no.  I thought about it for practically the entire flight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop Jack, I'm getting all weepy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took the road less traveled, Adelle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And look where it's led you... (picking up the phone) I'm gonna get her on the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pauses, focused on the message, his mind drifting back... Adelle begins dialing the number.  Finally, Jack reaches out and hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?!  You almost married this woman.  Aren't you even curious what she wants?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's probably just having a fit of nostalgia.  You know, lonely Christmas Eve, call the one that got away, that kind of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adelle rolls her eyes at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, it's ancient history...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks up as PETER LASSITER, 60s, founder and chairman of P.K. Lassiter and Associates, saunters into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight forty-five on Christmas Eve and Jack Campbell is still at his desk.  There's a Hallmark moment for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lassiter heads to the bar like he's done it a million times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter.  I don't see you rushing home to trim the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pouring himself  a scotch) That's because I'm a heartless bastard who only cares about money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And God love you for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lassiter drops down in a soft leather chair opposite Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sipping the scotch) I just got a call from Terry Haight.  Bob Thomas is nervous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll happen when you're about to spend thirty billion dollars on some aspirin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's gonna have to nurse him through this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you staring at my breasts, Peter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you, tiger..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aspen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pauses for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Adelle) Call Aunt Irma.  Tell her I won't be able to make it tomorrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adelle rolls her eyes at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a credit to capitalism, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack glances at Adelle, then looks back at Lassiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Peter, lemme ask you a question.  An old girlfriend calls you out of the blue on Christmas Eve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You suddenly having trouble getting dates?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not by a long shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then leave it in the past. Old flames are like old tax returns.  You keep `em in the file cabinet for three years and then you cut `em loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack shoots Adelle a satisfied smile, crumpling up Kate's message and tossing a perfect hook into a N.Y. Knicks hoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Adelle) I'll leave from the office tomorrow afternoon.  Call the group.  Schedule an emergency strategy session for noon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be a nice little holiday treat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single light remains on in the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is alone in the office working on his computer, checking spreadsheets on a large flat screen monitor. Jack leans back in his chair rubbing his eyes.  He checks his watch.  It's past eleven.  He gets up, goes to the window, sees the city in all its Christmas glory, then he see it... ...the message from Kate, crumpled in the trashcan...then turns back to the window, gazing out at the night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack comes out of the elevator, walking past the lobby desk where FRANK, a security guard, sits watching the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Campbell.  Why didn't you call down, I would've had Joe get your ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks outside the front door to the snowy, quiet street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking I might walk tonight, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice night for it.  I'll have Louis send your car home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nod from Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas to you, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  To you too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack puts on a pair of soft leather gloves and heads out into the crisp night air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack emerges from the building, walking across the large plaza, past the fountain...snow begins to fall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's walking down the nearly empty street, snow falling down on him, a bounce in his step, looking at the windows of the closed shops along the way. He gets to the end of the block spots the Wong Brothers' 24 Hour Deli across the street... He heads toward it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks into the brightly lit deli... SAM WONG, 20s, is with his 80-year-old GRANDFATHER behind the counter.  There's a NERDY COLLEGE KID at the salad bar, a drunken DEPARTMENT STORE SANTA at the liquor display, a WOMAN with a BABY in an aisle and... ...a BLACK MAN, 30s, with a dollar sign and the name "CASH" tattooed on his arm, stands in front of the coffee machine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah...yeah, yee-ah!  She's a certified winner...paper- thin but good as gold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack notices Cash talking to himself, seemingly crazy. Jack approaches Sam Wong at the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egg nog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Dairy case.  Five dollar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the b.g., to  Sam Wong) Y'all do the lotto here...? `Cause I got me a winner...I know, I know, Lotto keeps the black man down... but not me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack grabs a carton of egg nog, then notices Cash handing Sam Wong his ticket.  Jack heads back toward the counter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...06...14...18...48...right there.  Four numbers...that's two hundred and thirty eight dollar... (a smile) Merry Christmas and shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely looking  at ticket) Ticket bad.  You draw in lines with pencil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throwing the ticket  back) You draw lines with pencil!  I know about this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman with the baby looks over...the college kid looks up, nervous...the drunken Santa, bottle of bourbon in hand, starts to walk by Jack...Jack instinctively puts an arm out, holding the Santa back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!?  Look at the ticket...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out, I call 911.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Santa looks at Jack, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lookin' at me, you're not even lookin' at the ticket!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman with the baby puts a loaf of bread back on the shelf, starts nervously inching toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave now.  Take ticket somewhere else. (calling out) Next customer in line...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You first generation, xenophobic, money-theistic, hot pastrami sandwich making...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just watching...Cash shoves the ticket in Sam Wong's face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOK AT THE GODDAMN TICKET!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of decision for Jack.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully) Let me see that ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash turns to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (menacing) Was I talkin' to you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at the woman, the college kid, the Santa, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll buy it from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Cash walks over to Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy in $2,000 suit gets ass kicked tryin' to be a hero. Film at eleven... (then...turning to  the coffee machine) What?!  Oh no, not another lookie-loo.  You know how big a job this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patrons exchange nervous glances...Jack watches, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're double bookin' me! You're gonna get double billed!  Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash throws a bottle of Perrier against the wall, it SHATTERS.  The woman reels back in terror with the baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, c'mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a flash, Cash whips a .38 from the back of his pants, aiming it at Jack's face.  The woman SCREAMS, covers her baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Jack's face) Do you want to die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stares at Cash, trying his best to keep his cool...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DO YOU WANNA DIE?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a smile) Yes you do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm talking about a business deal here.  I buy the ticket for two hundred, take it to a store where the guy behind the counter... (glaring at Sam Wong) ...doesn't have a death wish (back to Cash) ...I just made myself a quick thirty eight dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash gets closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, it's a business deal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, you are the real thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash narrows his eyes...then, a smile as he puts the gun back into his pants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Jack, let's get outta here... (to Sam Wong) You were lookin' at me, papa, you shoulda been lookin' at the ticket.  That ticket was legit, B.  You're fake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash starts out of the deli.  Jack follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Cash walking down the street...Jack, holding his carton of egg nog under his arm, counting out two hundred dollars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know my name was Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I call all you white guys "Jack."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack nods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you seem pretty relaxed for a guy who just had a gun pulled on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way I was gonna die in that deli... (off Cash's look) Let's just say I've been on a lucky streak lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a big LAUGH) A lucky streak, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack hands him the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound pretty sure of yourself, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're telling me, you've got a gun to your head and you don't think for one second, what if this, what if that, maybe I shouldn't do this, I shoulda done that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't do that.  That's just not for me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash looks at him, then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Jack.  Nice doing business with you... Cash is about to take off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to carry that gun around for, anyway? You're just gonna do something you'll regret...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to talk about regrets, you're talking to the wrong person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack casually takes the egg nog out of the bag, opens the carton...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying that you seem like a smart guy.  At a certain point you're gonna do something, and then there's no turning back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, in most cases that'd be true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack takes a sip of the egg nog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean there must be programs out there, opportunities...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a deep laugh) Wait a minute, wait a minute... you're tryin' to save me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look from Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, you're serious... (out to the street) This man thinks I need to be saved!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone needs something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash looks at Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just said everyone needs something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got everything I need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.  It must be great being you.  You got it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash looks at Jack.  He smiles and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not saying you'd be able to do it without some hard work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a hearty LAUGH) You still think this is about me, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure it's about you.  But it's about society, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, I'm gonna enjoy this one... Just remember, Jack, you did this.  You brought this on yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, Cash turns and leaves Jack alone on the street with his egg nog...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks in and throws his keys on a table.  He takes off his gloves and overcoat, glances at the mail, then heads into the bedroom. Through the large windows we see snow falling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, flat on his back in bed, fast asleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close in on JackВ’s face, bathed in morning light...he  opens his eyes...feels something strange... Jack looks down...thereВ’s a womanВ’s head resting on his chest. A look of confusion crosses his face...trying to  remember... did he meet a woman last night...? He turns his head to find a large MUTT sitting  faithfully beside the bed, wagging his tail... ...did she have a dog? He looks down at the woman again, craning his neck to  get a look at her face.  And then he sees her... ...KATE REYNOLDS... ...now 34 and even more beautiful, a look of utter  contentment on her radiant face, sleeping soundly... His head darts around the room - itВ’s cramped and lived  in, clothes and toys are strewn about, family photos on  the dresser, Laura Ashley curtains, a tiny poster bed  and a charming little bay window. He instinctively reaches for his Franck Mueller watch  on the night stand, but itВ’s not there.  ItВ’s a Timex  Indiglo and it reads, В“7:57 A.M...В” Jack looks back at Kate...he rubs his eyes...maybe itВ’s  a dream...but nothing changes.  Then, Kate stirs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm...ten more minutes,  Jack... itВ’s Christmas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack jumps as he hears Kate talk for the first time... Suddenly, the door bursts open...A SIX YEAR OLD GIRL,  ANNIE, in a little nightgown, walks into the room  carrying an 18 MONTH OLD BOY, JOSH, SINGING at the top  of her lungs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jingle bells, Santa s mells, Rudolph laid an  egg...la la la, la-la la  la, la la la la la...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie places Josh on the bed and then jumps up  herself.  She gestures to the dog, patting the bed. ANNIE (CONTВ’D) You too, Luce...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog faithfully jumps on the tiny bed, joining  everybody else and leaving very little room.  Annie  starts jumping. ANNIE (CONTВ’D) Rise...and...shine...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stirring) YouВ’re jumping,  sweetheart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at this activity like a man at his own  funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, donВ’t you think we  need to open the  presents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy) Mommy needs five more  minutes in la la land.   That could be her  present...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh crawls directly up to JackВ’s stomach, climbing  on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CВ’mon, Dad.  Get up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said В“Dad.В” ThatВ’s it.  Jack moves the baby gingerly over, then  gets out of bed, stumbling over a baseball bat lying  next to it. He picks up the bat...the same Willie Mays autograph  bat that was encased in glass in his N.Y. apartment. Frightened, Jack drops the bad, looking down at himself  for the first time...heВ’s naked... ...a mortified look on his face as he sees the kids on  the bed... ...he quickly grabs a pair of sweat pants and a yellow  cardigan off the chair and throws them on... Kate, still half asleep, reaches out her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack turns by instinct.  Kate grabs him, drawing him  near.  A look of fear on his face as Kate opens her  eyes... Eye contact...JackВ’s certain heВ’s about to hear her  scream... KATE (CONTВ’D) (still groggy) Strong coffee, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lets him go as Jack backs out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A garishly decorated Christmas tree sits in the middle  of this messy and disorganized living room, a bevy of  gifts underneath and four red stockings over the  fireplace. Jack darts to the top of the steps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling from  the bedroom) Use an entire can if you  have to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back at the bedroom, then at the  stairs...quickly heading down the CREAKY steps, still  in shock. He grabs an overcoat from a hook by the front  door...about to step out when he looks down and  realizes... ...heВ’s barefoot.  He glances at a pair of rubber over- boots sitting by the door, slips them on, just about to  leave when... He hears the sound of a KEY TURNING in the door  lock...Jack looks at the door, not quite sure what to  do... The door opens...into the house, arms laden with  wrapped gifts, walk BIG ED and LORRAINE REYNOLDS (both  60s), KateВ’s parents.  Big EdВ’s wearing a ten gallon  hat and a suede overcoat.  Lorraine has a cigarette  dangling from her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drawing on a  memory) Ed?  Lorraine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Ed hugs Jack as best he can with an armful of  gifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack you olВ’ bird dog.   Merry Christmas to yaВ’...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorraine plants a big fat kiss on JackВ’s cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to him, Jack.   Please.  One day a year  away from the Ponderosa.   I donВ’t think thatВ’s too  much to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that.  This is  who I am, woman! (a wink to Jack) Tell her, Jack!  YouВ’re  the only one who gets me,  for godВ’s sake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, still holding the door open, plotting his escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need some egg nog...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В‘Course you do.  Hell,  itВ’s almost 8 a.m.   (shouting upstairs) Where are my two lВ’il  pardners?  Annie!  Josh!   Giddy up, Bid EdВ’s here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack dashes out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going,  Jack? (to Big Ed) WhereВ’s he going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damned if I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to remove their coats, when... The door flies back open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WhereВ’s my car?!  WhereВ’s  my Ferrari!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you  talking about? (to Lorraine) WhatВ’s he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, can I just borrow  your car?!  I promise  itВ’ll be returned!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caddy?  Why donВ’t you  take your own damn car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh just let him borrow  your precious Cadillac,  for godВ’s sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack spots a set of keys hanging on a hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HeВ’s got a perfectly good  mini-van sitting out  there in the driveway!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack grabs the keys off the hook...darts back outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack emerges from this charming, suburban two-story  house, some tasteful Christmas lights decorating a tree  in the center of the snow-covered lawn... He races to a blue Dodge mini-van sitting in the  driveway, a В“My Ferrari Is In The ShopВ” sticker on the  rear bumper.  He climbs into the mini-van and peels out  of the driveway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sees a sign, В“George Washington Bridge - 3 milesВ”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack driving over the bridge.  A sigh of relief as he  passes under a sign for В“Manhattan.В”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mini-van pulls up near JackВ’s apartment building.   Jack, still wearing pajamas under the coat, leaps out,  running toward the grand entrance where Tony stands  sternly in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony, thank god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack starts to walk past but Tony blocks the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, pal.  Entrance is  for residents and guests  only...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking  about?  ItВ’s me, Jack  Campbell.  Penthouse C.   I put you into commercial  paper!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not moving) Uh-huh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Mrs. Peterson walks to the door with  her little DOG.  Tony opens the door for her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth Peterson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little dog starts BARKING ferociously at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tony re:  Jack, annoyed) Who is this man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony shrugs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me, Betty.  You  do.  Jack Campbell.   WeВ’re on the co-op board  together.  We fought side  by side for garbage  disposals.  Every morning  we exchange quasi-sexual  witty banter.  Think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Jack with a raised eyebrow, the dog still  YAPPING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mrs. Peterson) Should I call the cops?   IВ’m gonna call the  cops...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pleads to her with his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising a hand  to Tony) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a sigh of relief) Thank you, Betty.  I know  if I can just sleep this  off, IВ’ll be fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And sleep you shall.   Noblesse oblige is not  dead.  Not yet  anyway...Come, letВ’s get  you some help.  Surely  there must be a shelter  somewhere in this city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shelter?!  IВ’m the  richest guy in the  building...IВ’ve got twice  the square footage you  have!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Peterson shakes her head at him, a look of pity on  her face. Frustrated, Jack turns and runs back to the mini-van...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pulls up across the street and gets out of the  van.  Running across the empty plaza toward the  building entrance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack bursts through the door, approaching the lobby  desk where FRANK the security guard sits. Frank spots Jack and blocks his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa...hold  it right there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank.  WhereВ’s Alan  Mintz?  Is he here yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mintz? (a knowing chuckle) I donВ’t think  so...buildingВ’s closed  pal.  YouВ’ll have to come  back tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I donВ’t know whatВ’s  going on here but I am  Senior Vice President of  this company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I donВ’t care who you  are.  ItВ’s Christmas and  like I told you the  building is closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe youВ’re not hearing  me.  I am Jack  Campbell... (approaching the  building directory) Right here.  Jack  Campbell, President...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he sees it...В”ALAN MINTZ - PRESIDENT,В” listed  plain as day on the building director... Jack looks at Frank, then back to the building  directory... A pitying look from Frank...Jack stands there, in  shock... CHAPTER FIVE - WHATВ’S HAPPENING?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...itВ’s desolate... Jack walks through the plaza like a zombie, his face  registering nothing.  He crosses the street, moving toward the mini-van...oblivious...when... SCREECH...a Ferrari 456M stops within inches of JackВ’s  torso...a VOICE from the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Watch where youВ’re  walking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack turns...sees the DRIVER low in the seat...canВ’t  quite make out the face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You almost dented my two  hundred thousand dollar  car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack...still stunned...looks at the car, very  familiar...the voice of the driver, also familiar... VOICE (CONTВ’D) ThatВ’s right!  My new  carВ’s worth more than  your shitty house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of realization on JackВ’s face... VOICE (CONTВ’D) I feel like I really did  win the lottery!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...itВ’s Cash, and heВ’s in JackВ’s car... Jack moves over to the passenger window in shock...a  smile from Cash...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss me, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThatВ’s my car!  You stole  my car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s a callable asset  seized in accordance with  the acquisition by-laws  of your alt-fate  contract...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basically, itВ’s my car  now.  Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash reaches over and opens the door.  Jack  hesitates... CASH (CONTВ’D) Look, I donВ’t make the  rules, Jack.  This is how  it works.  Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash gives him a reassuring look.  Jack gets in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack closes the door...Cash joyfully drives off in a  burst of acceleration...Jack practically ends up in the  back seat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might wanna fasten your  seat belt, Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recovering) What the hell is  happening to me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s freaking out and Cash is enjoying every minute  of it.  Cash hands Jack a paper bag.  Jack starts  breathing into the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kinda thing makes a  lotta guys throw up.   Seen it happen.  So if  you get the urge, do it  out the window. (with a taunting  laugh) I donВ’t want you marring  this exquisite leather  interior...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash looks over at Jack...heВ’s really losing it,  sobbing into the bag...almost hyperventilating...Cash  smiles... CASH (CONTВ’D) Look, I donВ’t know what  youВ’re getting so worked  up about, you did  this...you brought this  on yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brought what on myself?!   I didnВ’t do anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?  CВ’mon, Jack...IВ’ve  got everything I need, I  donВ’t have regrets,  thatВ’s just not for me...  sound familiar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean because you  thought I was cocky IВ’m  now on a permanent acid  trip?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash gets a laugh out of JackВ’s overreaction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone else in that  store is a statue, they  see their lives passing  in front of their eyes,  but not you.  YouВ’re  making a business deal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enraged) Give me my goddamn life  back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You?  What about me?  IВ’m  working hard for you  here, Jack.  On Christmas  too!  Now you did a good  thing last night,  intervening that way.  I  was moved...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Please.  Just tell me  whatВ’s happening to me.   In plain English.  None  of that mumbo jumbo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash turns to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s a glimpse, Jacko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I glimpse?  A glimpse of  what!?  What glimpse?!   Glimpse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, eventually,  everybody gets one...some  of В‘em take a couple  seconds... (looking at Jack) ...some of В‘em take a lot  longer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you a direct  question!  A glimpse of  what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look from Cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figure it out.  You got  plenty of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as it takes to  figure it out.  Which, in  your case, could be  considerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I just want my life  back.  Now whatВ’s it  gonna take?  You wanna  talk turkey?  LetВ’s talk  turkey!  How much  money...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash looks at Jack, relishing the moment.  He flashes  Jack a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look like I need  your money.  It doesnВ’t  work like that and I  canВ’t tell you why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you got to figure  it out for yourself. (beat) Are you listening to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figure it out?  Figure  what out?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash just stares at him... JACK (CONTВ’D) ThatВ’s it?  ThatВ’s all I  get?!  A glare?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Jack, in my  experience the best way  people deal with this is  to just relax and breathe  through it...let it come  to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack faces Cash, simmering...with frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I donВ’t have time  for this right now.  IВ’m  in the middle of a  deal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh youВ’re working on a  new deal now...did I mention that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what?  IВ’ve had  it with you.  IВ’ve had it  with all of this shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREECH...Cash slams on the brakes...practically  sending Jack through the windshield. Jack recovers, looks up...the car is parked right next  to the mini-van. Cash pulls out a small plastic bag, holding it out to  Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks inside the bag, pulls out a BARBIE BICYCLE  BELL.  He looks at it curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WhatВ’s this, a signal?   Will you come whenever I  ring it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look like I live in  a bottle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash reaches across Jack and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lost) But what do I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Jack IВ’m late.  IВ’d  love to help you out some  more but I gotta go  handle my business... (gesturing to  the mini-van) Happy trails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks out to the lonely street outside, then back  to Cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you did this to me,  you canВ’t just leave me  like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash looks at Jack, the desperation on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  You want to know  everything, IВ’ll tell you  everything.  But not  here.  LetВ’s get some  air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s still a little unsure...he sees Cash open the  driver side door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) Thanks, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack gets out of the car...and before he can even turn  around, CashВ’s door SLAMS shut and the car takes off in  a blast of horsepower... Jack stands there gazing down the street, listening to  the sound of the Ferrari shifting gears,  disappearing... The wind whips up...shivering, Jack looks toward the  Lassiter Building, then to the plastic bag in his hand,  and finally to the mini-van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blue mini-van snakes through the curved streets of  the neighborhood, almost all the houses decorated for  Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s trying to find the house, a map unfolded on the  steering wheel and the carВ’s registration in his  hand... He spots ARNIE BENDER, late 30s, carrying an empty  science kit box to the trash.  His wife, JEANNIE, also  late 30s, is getting in a Ford Taurus wagon, a bowl of  fruit in hand... Jack pulls up to the curb near Arnie, rolling down the  window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  Do you know  where Merrison Street is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnie looks up and sees Jack in the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to his wife) Jeannie!  I found Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack follows Arnie into the den of this garishly  decorated suburban home, ArnieВ’s arm around his  shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look terrible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack takes in the decor В– itВ’s a male leisure time  fantasy В– old pinball machine, wide screen TV, dart  board, and kitschy В‘50s style bamboo bar... ARNIE (CONTВ’D) Truth is I expected you.   Kate called before and  asked if I knew where you  were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnie notices JackВ’s fascination with the room... ARNIE (CONTВ’D) I know, I moved the  Barca-lounger into the  corner.  ItВ’s throwinВ’  everybody off.  What do  you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a nod) Great room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A satisfied smile from Arnie, JackВ’s approval means  something to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me, buddy.  We  know how to live...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnie shepherds Jack onto a bar stool and pours a drink  out of a bamboo bottle holder. ARNIE (CONTВ’D) So Jack, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack doesnВ’t respond, his eyes drawn to a softball team  photo on the bar...Jack and Arnie kissing a huge trophy  with the caption, В“Plainfield, N.J. Softball League  Champs, 1994.В” ARNIE (CONTВ’D) I mean you leave the  house on Christmas  morning, you donВ’t tell  anyone where youВ’re  going...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks over from the photo to Arnie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WeВ’re friends, arenВ’t we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I donВ’t say it  enough but you moving in  next door to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnie makes a fist and gestures to his heart.  Jack  nods. ARNIE (CONTВ’D) Talk to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of decision for Jack as Arnie stands there,  open eyed, ready to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m having kind of a bad  day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) I read somewhere that the  suicide rate doubles  during the holidays...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A raised eyebrow from Jack. ARNIE (CONTВ’D) (to himself) What am I saying?  You  donВ’t need to hear  that... (back to Jack) All I meant was a lot of  people have a hard time  dealing with all the  forced reverie, thatВ’s  all.  Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble at work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I donВ’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s not Kate, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pauses at the mention of Kate.  ArnieВ’s eyes  widen... ARNIE (CONTВ’D) (proudly) You see, itВ’s like weВ’re  in each otherВ’s heads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KateВ’s my wife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at Arnie as if heВ’s seeking confirmation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a playful smile)  Just keep saying it,  Jack, like a mantra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnie comes out from behind the bar, taking Jack by the  arm. ARNIE (CONTВ’D) CВ’mon, I better walk ya  home.  SheВ’s mad enough  as it is, right...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 37        EXT. ARNIEВ’S YARD - SECONDS LATER Arnie walks Jack through his backyard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you fit the profile  exactly.  Thirties,  house, kids, financial  responsibilities.  You  start thinking...this  isnВ’t the life I dreamt  about.  WhereВ’s the  romance, whereВ’s the joie  de vivre?  Suddenly,  every lingerie ad in the  Newark Star Ledger  represents a life you  canВ’t have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking, then...) ItВ’s just two kids,  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chuckle from Arnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made a choice, Jack,  a promise to your wife.  Maybe sometimes it seems  like you gave up the  world, but look what you  got...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at...the backyard of the Campbell house...  cluttered with a swing set, a dog run with chewed up  lawn, and a wooden sun deck in the process of being  built... ARNIE (CONTВ’D) Four bedrooms, two and a  half baths, and a  partially finished  basement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack trips over a wayward BIG WHEEL. ARNIE (CONTВ’D) (shaking his head) Kids...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnie leads Jack toward the house. ARNIE (CONTВ’D) Okay look, you probably  donВ’t want to hear this  right now but remember what you told me last  summer when I almost had  that thing with Arnie  Jr.В’s speech therapist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blank stare from Jack as they arrive at the sliding  glass door...Arnie faces Jack squarely, grabbing his  shoulders and looking him in the eye. ARNIE (CONTВ’D) DonВ’t screw up the best  thing in your life just  because youВ’re a little  unsure about who you  are.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnie gives Jack a comforting smie... ARNIE (CONTВ’D) God, it feels so good to  finally give something  back to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnie turns Jack toward the door and slides it open. ARNIE (CONTВ’D) IВ’m gonna hug you now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnie gives Jack a gentle hug...then gives him a little  push toward the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack steps inside.  He turns back to the door but  ArnieВ’s gone. Then, Kate enters the room, holding a portable phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hold on a second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cups the receiver.  Jack looks at her, sheВ’s  dressed now, nothing fancy but she looks great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cut your hair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A curious look from Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten years ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate just stands there looking at Jack, giving away  nothing. KATE (CONTВ’D) Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a resolute nod, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Never mind, he just  walked in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack grimaces as she resolutely hangs up the phone then  stares him down angrily. KATE (CONTВ’D) Do you have any idea what  you put us through  today?!  You walk out of  here at 7:30 in the  morning, donВ’t tell me  where youВ’re going, or  even that youВ’re going,  and I donВ’t see you В‘til  hours later.  I had state  troopers looking for  you!  I called  hospitals... (pointing at  the phone) ...I was just on the  phone with the morgue  for godВ’s sake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack watches her vent, the frustration on his face  building. KATE (CONTВ’D) What kind of man leaves  his family on Christmas  morning without a word  about where heВ’s going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s almost to a breaking po        INT. KATE (CONTВ’D) What kind of man does  that!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping in) I donВ’t know!  Please  stop yelling at me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city?  New York  City?  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because thatВ’s where I  live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack...donВ’t even  start...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you donВ’t  understand.  I woke up  here...and this is very  strange ...this is not my  house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A raised eyebrow from Kate.  Jack moves around the  room... JACK (CONTВ’D) (pointing upstairs) IВ’m not В“Dad...В”.  Kate,  youВ’re not my wife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks him over, assessing, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, Jack?   ItВ’s not funny this  time.  IВ’m really angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares him down, expecting an answer.  But he has  no answer. KATE (CONTВ’D) (loudly) Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack takes the bell out of the plastic bag that Cash  gave him, holds it up in front of her and starts  RINGING it furiously. Then...Annie rides into the room on her new bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: bell) WhatВ’s that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack watches as she pedals over, reaches into his hand  and takes the bicycle bell... ANNIE (CONTВ’D) (examining the bell) I like this... (jumping up and  giving hima peck  on the cheek) ...thanks, Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie rides excitedly out of the room on her bike. Leaving Jack and Kate alone again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed the whole  thing, Jack.  The  pancakes, the  presents...you spent six  hours putting that bike  together and you didnВ’t  even get to see the look  on AnnieВ’s face when she  opened it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sees the disappointment on her face... KATE (CONTВ’D) You missed Christmas,  Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks down, almost ashamed...he relents, giving in  to the moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m...IВ’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks at him.  He seems sincere enough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we donВ’t have time  for this right now, weВ’ll  talk about it later.  Now  get dressed... (pointing to his  outfit) YouВ’re not wearing that  to the ThompsonsВ’ party.   I donВ’t care how  hilarious you think it  is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Party?  Oh no, I canВ’t go  to a party...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look forward to this  party all year.  WhatВ’s  with you today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me on this Kate.  I  really donВ’t think going  to a party is the right  move for me at the  present time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks at him a moment, then shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  Do whatever you  want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up the phone, starts dialing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Telling my mother she  doesnВ’t have to stay with  the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because youВ’ll be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’ll be ready in ten  minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks past her...toward a hallway door, Kate  watching him... He opens the door...itВ’s a closet. JACK (CONTВ’D) Christ... (turning around) Where the hell is the  bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, Jack.  IВ’m  laughing on the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light comes on... Jack walks in, looks in the mirror, determined to  collect himself...but somethingВ’s not right... He glances around...the bathroom is small and itВ’s  cluttered with KateВ’s razors, loofah, skin creams... ...none of this stuff is his... ...he looks in the mirror again, his face revealing a  forlorn sense of displacement... ...he stares at himself until...he starts to lose it...  anger, confusion...sadness...finally, he begins breaking After a moment, he turns on the water, rinsing his  face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack at the closet door, looking at a row of Hagar  slacks, Docker sport coats and imitation leather  shoes... He reaches in and touches the fabric on one of the  sport coats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just... (searching for  the words) ...this is sub-par...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie appears at the bedroom door, watching Jack at the  closet. He turns...sees Annie watching him...a look  exchanged... then, Annie runs away... Jack turns back to the closet and mournfully takes a  pair of the slacks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Kate, a casserole dish in her hand, walk up  the path to this tacky but large house, its outside  decorated with the most garish display of Christmas  decorations this side of Pasaic. Kate RINGS the doorbell... EVELYN THOMPSON, 30s, wearing a dress thatВ’s a bit too  tight and a bit too low cut, opens the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate!  Jack! (turning around,  to guests) Everybody, Jack and Kate  are here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks right past her...to the house filled with 50  GUESTS. A loud WHOOP from the guests...Jack has the look of a  condemned man on his face as he follows Kate inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kate heads into the living room, Evelyn takes JackВ’s  arm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suggestively) Like the dress...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at it) ItВ’s lovely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a satisfied smile) I thought I saw you  notice it at the kidsВ’  recital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack shoots her a confused look...then walks in, trying  to catch up with Kate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party is in full swing, Christmas music in the  b.g., GUESTS talking, laughing, drinking egg nog... JackВ’s eyes dart around the room...itВ’s large, neater  than his and KateВ’s house but still very lived in...The  Thompson KIDS run in and out of the room, playing with  new toys... nobody is wearing or eating anything  imported from Europe, but everyoneВ’s having a good  time... ...everyone except for Jack, standing with Arnie and  THE GUYS, having his ear chewed off by NICK CARELLI, a  walking advertisement for LeviВ’s Cotton Dockers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see Van Horn last  night?  This kidВ’s gonna  single-handedly save  basketball in the state  of New Jersey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nets?  YouВ’re kidding,  right...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at him in disbelief. JACK (CONTВ’D) (recovering) Well...theyВ’re certainly  due.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILL KRAMER, a huge pile of fried chicken wings on his  plate, tugs at JackВ’s shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tomorrowВ’s the big  day, Jackie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Triple bypass.  IВ’m going  under the knife.  I told  you, didnВ’t I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Triple bypass? (pointing to his  plate) You really think you  should be eating all  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?  I figure IВ’m  going in for a cleaning  tomorrow, I might as well  load up on the fried  stuff tonight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thinking, Bill.   Have another drink. (whispering to Jack) HeВ’ll be lucky if he  lives through the  night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick reaches into his pocket and pulls out a packet of  Dutch Masters cigars.  He shows them to Jack, Jack nods  politely.  Nick eagerly hands him one... Nick lights JackВ’s cigar, then his own...enjoying that  first puff...smiling at Jack...Jack dutifully takes a  puff of the cigar...nods back at Nick...but itВ’s an  effort... Evelyn Thompson approaches, a tray of MUSHROOM PUFFS in  hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding out a  puff to Jack) Finger food...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I donВ’t think so, thank  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suggestively) CВ’mon, as soon as I put  them down, youВ’re gonna  grab a couple...you  always do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sees Evelyn and Jack from her position on the  other side of the room...Kate watches as... Evelyn holds the puff up to JackВ’s mouth, slowly  putting it near his lips... EVELYN (CONTВ’D) Let me.  TheyВ’ll melt in  your mouth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He instinctively opens his mouth as Evelyn pushes the  treat inside... EVELYN (CONTВ’D) Good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On JackВ’s face...if freezer burn were a facial  expression, this would be it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forcing a smile)  TheyВ’re great!  Thank  you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Evelyn licks her fingers suggestively then hands  Jack the entire tray with a sexy smile... A raised eyebrow from Kate, still watching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mushroom puffs arenВ’t the  only thing I do well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well do whatever it is  you do well, and  just...just do it.   Excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn nods as Jack walks toward the staircase... Kate follows Jack with her eyes as he climbs the  stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is sitting on the arm of a couch filled with  guestsВ’ coats, talking on a FOOTBALL SHAPED  telephone...the tray of mushroom puffs on the table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly, into phone) ...what do you mean he  wonВ’t come to the phone?! (standing, indignant) Do you realize how much  money IВ’ve made for that  sonuvabitch in the last  eight years?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click.  A dial tone.  Jack slams the phone down... JACK (CONTВ’D) Damnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams the phone again...and again...and again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack turns, sees Kate standing in the doorway, watching  him take his frustrations out on the phone, concern on  her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure youВ’re  okay...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A forced smile from Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, IВ’m fine.  ItВ’s just  this god awful football  phone!  Who has a phone  like this anyway?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doubtful)   Uh huh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate notices the tray of mushroom puffs on the table. KATE (CONTВ’D) You must really love  EvelynВ’s mushroom puffs,  huh? (with a wink) You know theyВ’re not  real...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and leaves...Jack looks at her, confused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack comes down the stairs, a lost look in his eyes.   He looks across the room and sees... Kate, with a group of GUESTS, looking great in her  jeans and white blouse, the center of attention. Jack passes through the guests, people waving to him,  slapping him on the back as he approaches Kate... He catches KateВ’s eye...she gives him a subtle smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to guests) ...then she asks me to  put this sweater on.   What choice do I have,  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack watches as Kate charms the crowd... KATE (CONTВ’D) But as IВ’m slipping it on  I notice sheВ’s misspelled  the word В“lawyers.В” (laughing) I had to go through the  entire day wearing a hand  embroidered sweater that  said, В“Non-Profit Layers  Do It For Free.В”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guests laugh again.  Even Jack finds himself  laughing, until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate, off-hand) So youВ’re a lawyer...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chuckle from the group.  KateВ’s confused. JACK (CONTВ’D) A non-profit lawyer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are starting to LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little embarrassed) Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pro bono.  You donВ’t get  paid at all.  Nobody  makes a dime.  Well,  bravo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blank stares from everyone, including Kate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Jack walk in the front door...the dog greets  them happily, jumping up on Jack, a weary look on his  face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better go wake my mother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate grabs a leash off a hook and hands it to Jack. KATE (CONTВ’D) Here you go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YouВ’re kidding me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SheВ’s your dog, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sheВ’s not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, sheВ’s the kidВ’s  dog.  LetВ’s go wake Josh,  see if he wants to walk  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But itВ’s twenty degrees  outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sympathetic) YouВ’re having a bad day,  IВ’ll go with  you...actually, thereВ’s  no way in hell youВ’re  gettinВ’ me back out  there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at the dogВ’s face.  Lucy couldnВ’t be more  excited.  Finally, Jack shakes his head and takes the  leash. KATE (CONTВ’D) (heading up the  stairs) Make sure you reward her  verbally when she does a  number two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of CRICKETS. Jack, wearing a down jacket, is being dragged down the  street by Lucy, his breath condensing in the cold  winter air.  The dog sniffs at a hydrant and a couple  of garbage cans, but isnВ’t doing her business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figure it out...IВ’m s crewed...donВ’t have to  be a genius to figure  that out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog stops, sniffing at a manicured lawn... JACK (CONTВ’D) (to Lucy) ItВ’s as good a place as  any...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the dog keeps moving, pulling Jack with her. JACK (CONTВ’D) ...but obviously not up  to your high standards... (to himself) Okay...he said youВ’re  working on a new deal  now...fine, youВ’ve done a  thousand deals, whatВ’s  the first thing you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LucyВ’s sniffing around someoneВ’s Christmas display but  JackВ’s too wrapped up in his thought process to notice. JACK (CONTВ’D) Triage.  ItВ’s your  signature.  You survey  the damage, find out  everything you can, you  probe, leave nothing to  chance.  IВ’m just gonna  have to go detective.   How did you get  Mentadent?  You learned  everything there was to  know about toothpaste and  then you pounced...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack narrows his eyes, thinking about that deal... JACK (CONTВ’D) ThatВ’s our play here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resolute, Jack turns to the dog. JACK (CONTВ’D) If you could take a dump  some time in this  century, then we could go  home where itВ’s warm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks around at the unfamiliar houses... JACK (CONTВ’D) That is if I can even  remember how to get  home... (to Lucy) You remember, donВ’t you  girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the dog ignores him, dragging Jack along...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is in bed, fast asleep. Jack walks into the room, his face still red from the  cold outside.  He looks over at Kate, sleeping happily. He takes off his shirt and khakis, laying them neatly  on the chair.  He looks over at the pair of flannel  pajamas folded on the dresser.  He shakes his head,  resigned, then dons the pajamas and climbs into bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning light streams into the room.  The clock reads,  В“7:14.В” Jack opens his eyes В– a burst of light hitting them  from the window...like the morning light in his  Manhattan loft... He reaches across the bed...itВ’s empty... A smile of hope from Jack as he puts his head back on  the pillow...maybe it was only a day...Then...
