The sound of a baby CRYING from the next room...A  pained look on JackВ’s face as he realizes heВ’s still in Jersey. Now the baby is WAILING...Jack lies still a moment,  hoping itВ’ll stop...it doesnВ’t.  Then, he hears the  sound of the SHOWER TURN ON in the bathroom. He gets out of bed and walks to the bathroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shower is running, a tape player is BLASTING В“Beast  of Burden.В”  Kate is in the shower SINGING LOUDLY with  the song...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer... JACK (CONTВ’D) (louder, over music) Hello!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) ...my feet are hurtinВ’...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) HEY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, the music is turned down and Kate pulls the  shower curtain open... Jack sees her naked body...raises an eyebrow...thatВ’s  something heВ’s missed...then... JACK (CONTВ’D) Uh...that babyВ’s crying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unimpressed) And...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...her expression makes Jack turn his gaze from her  naked body. KATE (CONTВ’D) DonВ’t give me that look,  Jack, TuesdayВ’s your day  and you know it.  And try  to get Josh to day care  on time, okay?  He missed  the macaroni painting  last week...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the curtain and turns the radio back up.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 50        INT. JOSHВ’S ROOM - MORNING AnnieВ’s watching from a baby-size Laz-E-Boy lounger  as... Jack, in a robe, stands in front of a changing table,  Josh laying happily on his back, playing with a set of  plastic keys. Jack takes a fresh Huggies diaper and puts it next to  the baby.  He surveys Josh, scratching his chin and  rubbing his hands like Indiana Jones.  Josh playfully  grabs at JackВ’s nose. He looks over to Annie.  SheВ’s still staring at him  like heВ’s a Martian.  He looks at the instructions on  the box of Huggies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull tape...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack searches the diaper for the tabs of tape, then  gingerly pulls them apart, releasing the diaper from  the babyВ’s bottom, and seeing whatВ’s inside. JACK (CONTВ’D) Holy mother of god!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack holds the diaper out away from him, searching for  a place to put it.  Annie points to a Diaper Genie by  the dresser. Jack throws the diaper in, then quickly replaces the  lid.  Annie points to the container of Baby Wipes. JACK (CONTВ’D) You must be kidding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie stares at him a beat.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YouВ’re not really our  dad, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack turns to her.  SheВ’s looking back at him with  complete earnestness.  They stare at each other another  moment.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, IВ’m not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of curiosity from Annie. JACK (CONTВ’D) I work on Wall Street,  you know with the big  buildings...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response from Annie... JACK (CONTВ’D) I live in an apartment  house with a doorman, I  can buy just about  anything I want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie nods at Jack, still suspicious. JACK (CONTВ’D) This isnВ’t my real life.   ItВ’s just a glimpse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WhereВ’s my real dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I donВ’t know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A concerned look on AnnieВ’s face, JackВ’s petrified that sheВ’s about to cry. JACK (CONTВ’D) But donВ’t worry, he loves  you and IВ’m sure heВ’ll be  back very soon... (to himself) ...very, very soon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie approaches Jack, climbing up on a little chair  and tugging firmly at his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They did a pretty good  job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aliens...In the  mother ship.  You look  just like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh...thanks...slightly  better looking though,  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AnnieВ’s now stone faced, trying to decide about Jack. JACK (CONTВ’D) YouВ’re not going to start  crying, are you?  Because  IВ’m not really sure I  could deal with that  right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks about it for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a case by case  basis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how to make  chocolate milk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I could figure it  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promise not to kidnap  me and my brother and  implant stuff in our brains?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.  Then...a smile from Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s driving, Annie buckled in the front seat... Josh, in the baby seat, looks like he was dressed by  monkeys В– his shirt buttons are off by one, and theyВ’re clearly supposed to be in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stops the van outside the Playland Day Care  Center. ANNIE (CONTВ’D) This is day care.  ItВ’s  where babies go when  their parents are at  work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out of the van...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he pulls Josh out and walks quickly toward the  building, holding the baby away from his body. He gets to the door and holds Josh out to the DAY CARE  LADY.  She stares at JoshВ’s outfit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I get a receipt or  something...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman looks at Jack like heВ’s crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mini-van pulls up to the drop-off point at this  suburban New Jersey Y.  Annie opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have winter camp until  four, then ballet until  five thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five thirty.  Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try not to be late  because kids donВ’t like  to be the last one picked  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.  Good tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye...

dialogues.speaker: CHAPTER SEVEN
dialogues.text: Jack watches her as she runs toward the building.   Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out window) Hey!  Annie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie turns back toward him. JACK (CONTВ’D) Where do I go now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big EdВ’s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big EdВ’s?  Big EdВ’s  Tires? (suspicious) Why...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThatВ’s where you work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean I sell tires...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shrugs her shoulders and walks off. JACK (CONTВ’D) ThatВ’s what I do.  IВ’m a  tire salesman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s driving down a busy commercial street when he  spots something a hundred yards down the road...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good Lord...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a huge, three-story-tall plastic likeness of Big Ed  Reynolds, ten gallon hat, lassoing a tire... 55        EXT. BIG EDВ’S TIRES - MOMENTS LATER Jack approaches Big EdВ’s from the parking lot...slowly,  taking it all in... ItВ’s like a Pep Boys with a Texas theme.  A big retail  store for tires and auto parts, and a repair bay for  everything from alignments to brake jobs... Jack walks to the tire bay where HECTOR, 40s, a  Guatemalan mechanic in grease-stained coveralls, stands  with TOMMY the salesman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Jack, you happen to  know the stock number on  those new Michelin X1's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...lemme get back to  you on that one... (looking at his  name tag) Tommy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tommy) Thomas, why you bother  Jack about that.  Look it  up yourself... (to Jack) Okay Jack, we talk  later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack nods amiably then continues into the store... 56        INT. BIG EDВ’S TIRES - CONTINUOUS Jack walks in...looks around...the store is teeming  with activity, a post-holiday sale in progress... Big Ed, in his signature ten gallon hat, sees Jack from  behind the counter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack my boy!  You are  looking mighty worse for  the wear...Hey, guess who I played bridge with two  nights ago...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stares blankly at Big Ed... BIG ED (CONTВ’D)  Hell, youВ’ll never  guess.  One Sydney  Potter.  ThatВ’s Sydney  Potter, Chief Executive  Officer of BuyRite  Transport.  Only the  third largest trucking  company in the state.  I  even let the sonuvabitch  win, which wasnВ’t easy  because the guyВ’s been  bashed in the head by  Teamsters so many times  his brainВ’s like  porridge.  Anyhoo, heВ’s  looking for a new parts  supplier... we can handle  that kind of volume,  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack considers this briefly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m gonna have to get  back to you on that...Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Ed makes a gun gesture with his forefinger, winking  at Jack, then turns back to the activity at the counter  as... Jack spots KENNY, a very young sales associate, walking  by.  He reaches out and taps Kenny on the shoulder. JACK (CONTВ’D) Do I have a private  office somewhere in the  building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...sure Jack... (nervously pointing) Right back there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks into the office with his name on the door... 57        INT. JACKВ’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS ThereВ’s no Stairmaster here, no leather sofa or  bar...itВ’s small, cramped and cluttered, the walls  littered with tire inventory and price lists... Jack takes a slow, sad lap around the office. He makes it to the small wooden desk at the far end of  the room and sits down behind it... On the desk are photos of Jack, Kate and the kids, a  plastic Michelin Man model, a tire-themed day calendar  and a small plastic figurine of a BOWLER, the word,  В“Bowlers Do It In An AlleyВ” embossed on its base... He surveys the desktop briefly, then opens the top  drawer, finding a personal checkbook and looking  inside... He sees the bottom line and winces, then puts it  back... Jack picks up the В“Bowlers Do It In An AlleyВ” figurine  and gives it a good look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowlers do it in an  alley?...Non profit  lawyers do it for free...  what is it with these  people?  DonВ’t they  realize this refers to  sex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He replaces the figurine then opens the bottom drawer  where he spots a bottle of Glenfiddich.  He lifts it  out... JACK (CONTВ’D) At least you splurged on  some decent scotch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a paper cup and pours himself a shot.  He  drinks it down in one gulp and then crumples up the  cup, throwing it toward the NETВ’S basketball  hoop/garbage can near the door. He misses... He looks more closely at the photographs...most are  family photos, a happy Jack with Kate, with Annie at  the pony rides, at JoshВ’s birth...in every one of them,  Jack is smiling... JACK (CONTВ’D) (to Jack in  the photo) What are you smiling  about...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns his head...spots a small plaque on the wall  behind him.  It reads, В“Jack Campbell - E.F. Hutton #1  Junior Sales Associate, 1988.В”  Jack raises an  eyebrow... JACK (CONTВ’D) Number one...not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs it off the wall and looks at it more  carefully... JACK (CONTВ’D) 1988...?  I was in London  in 1988...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s jarred into reality... JACK (CONTВ’D) (to Jack in the photo) You never went to London... (picking up the photo) ...you never got on that  plane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stays there a moment...in shock.  Then... The P.A. system comes to life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over P.A.) Jack to mag  wheels...Jack, youВ’re  needed in mag wheels,  customer waiting!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 58        INT. BIG EDВ’S TIRES, MAIN FLOOR - MINUTES LATE Kenny leading Jack toward the В“Mag WheelsВ” section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I was the number one  junior sales associate at  E.F. Hutton in 1988.  Did  you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I didnВ’t...thatВ’s  great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThatВ’s the kind of thing  you can really build  on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean sales has always  been a feeder for M and  A, always...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach В“Mag WheelsВ” where TOMMY, a slick sales  associate, stands with a CUSTOMER looking at the  displays...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are, mag wheels... (a little concerned) Hey Jack, are you sure  youВ’re okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, IВ’m just a little  confused right now about  why I work here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny looks at him nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...I just started here  last Tuesday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack nods compassionately.  Kenny takes off leaving  Jack alone with his thoughts as Tommy approaches with  the customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the customer) So youВ’re all set on the  Skip Shift eliminator and  the Brembo rotors.   JackВ’s our point man on  alloy wheels...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Tommy) Do you know why do I work  here...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because youВ’re the best  damn tire guy in the  state of New Jersey... (proudly, to the  customer) Jack taught me everything  I know about the  business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The customer nods, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I taught you the business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another nod to the customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And heВ’s a crack-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything I taught you.   I want to hear it all,  right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TommyВ’s confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, IВ’m ready to buy  here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the customer) What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want some alloy wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack grabs one of the alloy rims off the shelf, holding  it out to the customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  These are great.   YouВ’ll need four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The customer takes the wheel from Jack, looks at it  confused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I donВ’t like these...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you heard the guy,  IВ’m the best damn tire  guy in the state of New  Jersey. (turning to Tommy) Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... (hesitating) Rule number one, the  customer is always  right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A satisfied smirk from the customer. 59        INT. BIG EDВ’S TIRES, JACKВ’S OFFICE - LATE AFT Jack is behind his desk, his tie loosened, on the  phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) ...I have no idea what  our inventory level is,  thatВ’s why IВ’m asking  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCK at the door... JACK (CONTВ’D) Look, just send us what  you sent us last month,  okay...?  And keep doing  that until further  notice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up the phone as the door opens.  Big Ed sticks  his head in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a minute, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’ve got all the time in  the world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Ed walks in, followed by SYDNEY POTTER, 60s, a  tough looking man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, meet Sydney Potter,  BuyRite Transport, one of  JerseyВ’s top  businessmen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Potter extends a hand, Jack rises from his chair,  trying to place the name.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and a helluva bridge  player.  EdВ’s told me a  lot about you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.  Potter nods his head at Jack,  immediately impressed.  Big Ed is beaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a heavy Jersey  accent) Lucky in cards, lucky in  business, lucky in love.   My cup runneth over... (to Big Ed) HeВ’s a nice looking  boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughterВ’s no slouch  either...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile from Potter, then a serious look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LetВ’s cut to the chase,  Jack.  Big Ed tells me  youВ’re the grease that  makes the wheels turn  around here.  I need a  new parts supplier for my  fleet.  You seem to have  the parts.  That we  know.  What we donВ’t know  is why the hell I should  buy them from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Potter stares Jack down.  But JackВ’s not about to be  intimidated by him.  He pauses, matching PotterВ’s  stare.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A surprised look from Potter.  An anxious laugh from  Big Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) CВ’mon Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Potter) I mean it.  From what I  can tell, weВ’re a mom and  pop operation, weВ’re  already over-extended in  sales, and any price  advantage we could offer  would easily be matched  by a larger supplier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack continues to stare down Potter. JACK (CONTВ’D) So like I said, I donВ’t  have any idea why you  should buy your parts  from us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The staring match continues.  Big EdВ’s getting more  nervous.  PotterВ’s the first to blink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you got my  attention...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for rule number  one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack smiles. JACK (CONTВ’D) The customer is always  right.  A clichГ©?  Sure.  The difference is, we  mean it.  WeВ’re small, we  need our customers.  We  canВ’t afford to  disappoint them, ever.  Yeah, you could go to  some leviathan supplier,  probably save a few  pennies on the price of  oil filters, but with us  you get more than a  supplier, you get a  bridge partner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile from Potter.  Jack gives Ed a wink.  Ed  watches, thrilled... JACK (CONTВ’D) You want to bid hearts,  weВ’re right there with  you.  You feel the need  to redouble, youВ’re not  going to get any argument  from us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Potter nods at Jack.  Jack moves in for the kill. JACK (CONTВ’D) The big guys may have the  high cards, but you know  as well as I do, Sydney,  high cards donВ’t always  take the trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Potter pauses a minute, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Big Ed,  re: Jack) I like him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Ed smiles, letting out a relieved sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a wink to Jack) ThatВ’s my boy... (an arm around Potter) CВ’mon, lemme show you the  rest of the ranch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Ed and Potter exit the office... BIG ED (CONTВ’D) (turning back to Jack) Nice shootinВ’, Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...leaving Jack there with a satisfied smile on his  face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is in bed watching CNBC...On the TV a young woman  REPORTER at the anchorВ’s desk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...advancers led  decliners by a nine to  four ratio and the  closing tick was a mildly  bullish plus seventy  six.  Much of the  marketВ’s action today was  fueled by the latest  round of merger mania to  hit Wall Street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Global Health Systems and MedTech logos appear on a  graphic in the corner of the screen... CNBC REPORTER (CONTВ’D, ON T.V.) ...when Global Health  Systems and MedTech  Pharmaceutical announced  their intentions to join  forces in a massive one  hundred and twenty two  billion dollar stock swap  deal.  Though neither  side expressed  significant regulatory  concerns at the  announcement press  conference, it is  believed that both the  FDA and the FTC will be  closely scrutinizing the  marriage, the largest  ever in the health care  industry.  When asked  about possible anti- competitive implications,  Global Chairman Bob  Thomas referred reporters  to P.K. Lassiter and  Company President Alan  Mintz, the original  architect behind the  deal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stares in shock as the image changes to a super  confident looking Mintz shaking Bob ThomasВ’ hand at the  press conference. CNBC REPORTER (CONTВ’D, ON T.V.) Ironically, Mintz first  met Thomas at a Lamaze  class...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Lamaze class...!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...while coaching their  pregnant wives, Mintz and T homas struck up a  dialogue about the need  for consolidation in the  rapidly growing health  care industry and two  months later, the deal  with MedTech was born...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!  ThatВ’s my deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other business news,  U.S. Labor Department  officials announced today that two hundred and  seventy-five thousand new jobs were created last  month, twenty-five  thousand less than  economists were  predicting, leading to a  mild rally in the bond  markets before midday.   But as the trading  session drew to a close,  the profit takers stepped  in and the long bond  closed at ninety seven  even, up only two ticks,  the yield inching down to  six point zero seven  percent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate comes into the room from the hallway wearing only  JackВ’s NYU sweatshirt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are asleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes over to the window and draws the blinds.  Jack  looks up at her, nods, then goes back to the TV. KATE (CONTВ’D) Jack.  I said the kids  are asleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted) Well thatВ’s just  great...those little  monkeys can be a real  handful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate shuts off the TV. JACK (CONTВ’D) Hey!  I was watching  that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we had a deal  about you watching CNBC  in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m working on a new deal  now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate throws a Kate BushВ’s В“The Sensual WorldВ” into the CD player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, but not tonight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs onto the bed, a seductive look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second.  You want  me, donВ’t you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the general idea,  yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate starts kissing him...but JackВ’s a little  uncomfortable with the sudden intimacy...he pulls back,  a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ShouldnВ’t we grab some  dinner first?  Maybe a  bottle of wine...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s ten thirty, Jack.   By eleven youВ’re gonna be  sprawled out on the bed  snoring your head off.   We donВ’t have time for  wining and dining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say...honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts kissing him again...but this time he just  goes with it, and as her hands run through his hair  heВ’s brought back to a different time and place... Jack momentarily pulls back and looks at her...itВ’s  like the first time heВ’s really looked at her in eleven  years... JACK (CONTВ’D) God...youВ’re beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at him, almost uncomfortable with the  compliment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, IВ’m serious...youВ’re  really stunning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is good stuff, Jack,  keep it coming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean back in college,  you were a very pretty  girl, thereВ’s no question  about that.  But this... (lost in her) ...youВ’ve really grown  into a beautiful woman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stares at her, entranced...Kate pulls back,  reacting to the intensity in his stare...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me like you  havenВ’t seen me every day  for the last twelve  years...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack freezes.  ThereВ’s love in her eyes but itВ’s not  meant for him... She kisses him... KATE (CONTВ’D) DonВ’t move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up off the bed and heads for the bathroom... He looks around...not sure what to do...Finally... He turns onto his side and closes his eyes... Kate emerges from the bathroom, she sees Jack on the  bed, hears his breathing heavy with sleep... At once charmed and disappointed, Kate sighs.  She  turns off the CD player and heads into bed. She pulls the covers up over Jack, shutting off the  light... She puts an arm around him, kissing him  sweetly on the neck... KATE (CONTВ’D) В‘night, honey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close in on JackВ’s face...turned away from Kate...he  opens his eyes...looks down at her arm...loneliness on  his face... CHAPTER EIGHT - THE MENВ’S DEPARTMENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s mid-January and all signs of the Christmas season a gone except for the snow on the ground in the busy parkin lot. 62        INT. MACYВ’S, MENВ’S DEPT. - DAY Kate, pushing Josh in the stroller and holding AnnieВ’s  hand, passing through the MenВ’s Dept., Jack lagging  behind, a bevy of shopping bags in hand and a  beleaguered look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to Jack) WeВ’re almost done here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Janes, Mom.  You  promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThatВ’s right.  Okay,  letВ’s make a quick stop  at the kidsВ’ shoe  department, pick up my  watch from the battery  place, then IВ’ll run into  the linen store...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unhappy look on JackВ’s face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why donВ’t we just go to  all the stores?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks back at Jack. JACK (CONTВ’D) Every single store in  this godforsaken shopping  mall.  We can go to them  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate gives him a look.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, Jack?!   IВ’ll go with the kids.   Why donВ’t you just hang  out here in the menВ’s  department... okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack glances at the MenВ’s Dept., sighs and gives Kate a  nod.  She takes off with the kids...and then he sees  it... ...the Zegna section.  HeВ’s drawn to the neat rows of  beautiful suits like a moth to the light... He approaches the rack, pulls out a dark green suit,  gently touching the soft wool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s perfect for your  frame...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack turns and sees a SALESMAN standing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to try it  on?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 63        INT. MACYВ’S MENВ’S DEPT. - A LITTLE LATER Jack, at a mirror wearing the Zegna suit.  It is  perfect for his frame.  The color is spectacular, the  line is dazzling. Jack looks in the mirror, shutting everything else  out... itВ’s like heВ’s seeing his old self...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look amazing in that  suit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack snaps out of his trance.  He sees Kate standing  behind him, Annie and Josh happily playing a few feet  away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean...wow...off the  charts great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s an unbelievable  thing.  Wearing this suit  actually makes me feel  like a better person. (taking one final  look) IВ’m gonna buy it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate raises an eyebrow, then looks at the price tag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: $2,400?!  Are you out of  your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to AnnieВ’s  new Mary Janes) She got those shoes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those shoes were twenty  five dollars.  CВ’mon,  take it off.  WeВ’ll go to  the food court and get  one of those funnel cakes  you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at her...itВ’s a moment of decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks at Jack, a little surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what  my life is like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wake up in the morning  covered in dog saliva...I  drop the kids off, spend  eight hours selling tires  retail...retail, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate just stands here, aghast... JACK (CONTВ’D) I pick up the kids, walk the dog, which by the  way, carries the added  bonus of carting away her monstrous crap...I play  with the kids, take out  the garbage, get six  hours of sleep if IВ’m  lucky, and then it starts  all over again...and why  is it that I always have  to drive everyone  everywhere?  I spend  practically my entire day  in that slow as hell  mini-van listening to  Raffi tapes and trying to  figure out how the cup  holders work...IВ’m sick  of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WhatВ’s in it for me?   Where are my Mary Janes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate stares at him, shaking her head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s sad to hear your  life is such a  disappointment to you,  Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I canВ’t believe itВ’s not  a disappointment to you! (letting it all out) Jesus, Kate, I couldВ’ve  been a thousand times the  man I became.  How could  you do this to me?  How  could you let me give up  on my dreams like this?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate stares at him in disbelief.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KateВ’s words pierce Jack...he has to avert his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowering his voice) Look, IВ’m sorry.  IВ’m  sorry I was such a saint  before and IВ’m such a  prick now.  Maybe IВ’m  just not the same guy I  was when we got  married...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe youВ’re not.  The  Jack Campbell I married  wouldnВ’t need a $2400  suit to make himself feel  better about his life,  but if thatВ’s what itВ’s  gonna take, then buy it.   Just buy the goddamn  suit ...we can take the  money out of the kidsВ’  college fund.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other for a moment...a stand-off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it... (taking off the  jacket) WeВ’ll get a funnel cake.   ItВ’ll be the highlight of  my week...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blue mini-van makes its way down this road...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThereВ’s an icy silence in the car...Jack is behind the  wheel, Kate next to him looking out the window, anger  on her face...

dialogues.speaker: CHAPTER NINE
dialogues.text: Jack checks the rear-view mirror, sees Annie and Josh  in the back, both asleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate) Listen, IВ’m sorry about  that back in the store.   I really donВ’t want to  fight with you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate just keeps looking out the window. JACK (CONTВ’D) But you must sometimes  wonder how we ended up  here.  I mean back in  college, did you see  us... (looking around) ...here...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’ll give you this, life  has thrown us a few  surprises...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glimmer in JackВ’s eye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It really has, hasnВ’t  it?  So if you had  to...what would you say  was the biggest surprise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances at the kids sleeping in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...Annie for one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise.  WeВ’re  pregnant... (a laugh) Yeah...that mustВ’ve  been...I mean that was  very unexpected.  But  what are you gonna do,  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it worked out  okay, donВ’t you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  I really like  Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, Jack.  Maybe weВ’ll  keep her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I love Annie.  We had  a lot of good times,  didnВ’t we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were young... (a nostalgic smile) Remember that little  place on Charles Street  we used to go to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles Street?  In the  Village?  When we were  living in Greenwich  Village...? (off her nod) Great times.  WhyВ’d we  ever leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You canВ’t really raise a  kid in an apartment in  the Village...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack nods, starting to piece it together. KATE (CONTВ’D) The trek out to the  hospital every day didnВ’t  help either... (looking at him) You were great.   Surviving the heart  attack was one thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had a heart attack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a laugh) Jack, stop that. I'm still mad at you... (a sigh) ...who knows what  wouldВ’ve happened if you  hadnВ’t stepped in at the  store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThatВ’s why I work for Big  Ed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look from Kate. JACK (CONTВ’D) (recovering) I mean, thatВ’s why I work  for Big Ed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks out at the road a moment, piecing it all  together in his mind. JACK (CONTВ’D) (almost to himself) So we had a baby, Big Ed  had a heart attack, we b ought that house, and  IВ’ve been working for him  ever since...Sayonara,  Wall Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks at him a little strangely. JACK (CONTВ’D) (turning to her) Our life in a nutshell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to look at it  that way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you look at it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances again at the kids in the back seat, then at  Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great success story...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile from Jack.  He admires her outlook even if he  canВ’t bring himself to share it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowded suburban New Jersey bowling alley... Jack stands at a lane holding a bowling ball, the  nickname В“The HammerВ” emblazoned over his bowling shirt pocket...He approaches the line and throws the ball  down the lane... ItВ’s ugly...The ball caroms off the hardwood into the  gutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (O.S., from behind) Jesus, Jack, this is a  league match, for godВ’s  sake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack turns.  Arnie and the BOWLING TEAM are in the  scorekeeping area watching Jack make a mockery of the  sport.  Jack scowls. ARNIE (CONTВ’D) WhereВ’s your follow  through?  WhereВ’s your  stance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, IВ’m doing the best I  can... (under his breath) IВ’d like to see you hit a  squash ball after  seventeen beers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YouВ’re right.  Why am I  so competitive!?   Compensation, I guess.   Look, just focus, Jack.   You can still pick up the  spare...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack retrieves his ball, sets up, genuinely  concentrating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, to  himself) You are Jack Campbell.   YouВ’re better than this  sport.  You shot the  rapids at Kenai.  You ran  with the bulls at  Pamplona.  You jumped out  of a plane over the  Mojave Desert, for  ChristВ’s sake.  You can  do this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack puts everything he has into the throw, heaving the  ball down the lane with as much grace and power as he  can muster...hitting the six pin and taking out four  others. JACK (CONTВ’D) (screaming, excited) Yeah!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, a fist pumped...But the guys could care  less...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to TEAMMATE) Okay, Pete, youВ’re up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks out of the menВ’s room, heading toward the  lounge.  He sees a familiar face walking toward him...a  woman in a sexy little bowling outfit, carrying a  bowling ball to a far lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of confusion as he tries to place the face.   Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny.  I saw you  out there on lane five.   What do you have the flu  or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a wink) Need a nurse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YouВ’re a nurse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If thatВ’s what you  want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brushes past Jack, continuing to her lane...Jack  follows her with his eyes a moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns. JACK (CONTВ’D) Are we...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we what, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something going  on between us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EvelynВ’s surprised at JackВ’s directness.  She stands  there a beat, then walks back toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we finally being  honest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would help me if we  were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, youВ’re right, weВ’ve  been dancing around this  for years...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn looks a little flush...she briefly fans her  face. EVELYN (CONTВ’D) God, my heart is racing.   Here goes... (a smile) When I get dressed for a  party and I know youВ’re  going to be there...  well, letВ’s just say I  donВ’t go strapless  because my husband likes  it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An intrigued smile from Jack. EVELYN (CONTВ’D) IВ’ve got six sets of snow  tires piled up in my  garage and I wonВ’t even  drive in the snow...And  our kids just happen to  be in the same ballet  class every year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks a piece of lint off his shirt. EVELYN (CONTВ’D) So, if youВ’re asking me  whether IВ’d like it to be  more, the answer is  yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of surprise from Jack. EVELYN (CONTВ’D) ...and Kate would never  have to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack considers this for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have your number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide smile from Evelyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SteveВ’s out of town with  the kids this week.  Why  donВ’t you just stop by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, leaving Jack standing there, watching her  sashay back to her lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks into the lounge, a little dazed.  He heads  over to Arnie whoВ’s having a beer at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Jack) Hey Jack, youВ’re all  flush.  I guess that  seventy-one took a lot  outta you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting down) I just saw Evelyn  Thompson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is relentless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to have an  affair with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah... (shaking his head) What is it about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing over a  napkin) So could you write down  her exact address?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa...whoa...wait a  second, Jack.  YouВ’re not  actually gonna cheat on  Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wouldnВ’t really be  cheating... (off ArnieВ’s  doubtful  look) ItВ’s complicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, maybe IВ’m not as  good a consigliere as you  are but you have to trust  me on this one.  A little  flirtationВ’s harmless but  youВ’re playing with fire  here.  The Fidelity Bank  and Trust is a tough  creditor.  You make a  deposit somewhere else,  they close your account  forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m telling you, those  rules donВ’t apply to me,  Arn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a chuckle) Screw the rules.  IВ’m  talking about the choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at him curiously. ARNIE (CONTВ’D) CВ’mon, Evelyn ThompsonВ’s  got no class.  She  doesnВ’t marry Dr. Steve,  the womanВ’s living in a  trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, is that really  necessary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All IВ’m saying it there  isnВ’t a guy in Union  County who wouldnВ’t give  his left nut to be  married to Kate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnie takes one last swig of his beer and gets up... ARNIE (CONTВ’D) IВ’ll see ya later,  Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves Jack alone, thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks into the house carrying his bowling bag.  He  dumps the bag in the coat closet and walks into the  kitchen where... Kate is at the counter, her back to him, poring over  some legal documents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking up) How was the game, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening the fridge) Long, boring, and  generally pretty sad.   Arnie seemed to enjoy  it... (peering inside) Hey, whereВ’s that chocolate  cake...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate turns around, revealing a huge hunk of chocolate  cake on a plate in front of her, a bite ready to go  into her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) You mean this chocolate  cake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThatВ’s my piece.  I was  saving it because I got  nauseated from that store  bought chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate takes the bite, a little piece of icing sticks to  the side of her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack approaches the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme that cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes another bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes a grab for the plate but she holds it out  where he canВ’t reach it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CВ’mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Jack.  ItВ’s too  important to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare each other down a moment.  Then... He tries to swipe the plate.  Kate jumps out of her  chair, running out of the kitchen with the cake,  laughing... Jack takes off after her...chasing her through the  house... just about the catch up to her when... She darts up the stairs, still laughing...he follows  her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want that cake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...reaches up...grabs her shirt...pulls her down  playfully on top of him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) You want the cake!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath) I want it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, then takes the whole piece in her  hand and smooshes it right in his mouth... Beat.  Then, Jack starts laughing... JACK (CONTВ’D) Thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s good, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a big clump of it and smooshes it in her  mouth. They stay there a moment, lying on the stairs, feeding  each other cake, laughing. Jack leans back on the stairs.  He looks at KateВ’s  face, practically covered in cake, smiling, and  realizes... ...he hasnВ’t laughed like this in thirteen years.   Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are the kids asleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sexy smile from Kate...they start kissing  passionately right there on the steps...itВ’s heating  up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (caught up in the  moment) Say it, Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CВ’mon, you know what I  like to hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the throes  of passion) Yeah, baby, I know what  you like to hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing him) Then say it...just say it  to me...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swept up in the  moment) Oh yeah, youВ’re a bad  girl, baby... You make me  so hot...IВ’m gonna take  you to that special  place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks up at her, he can practically see the  passion drain from her face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice, Jack.  YouВ’re  sweeping me off my feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You make me hot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up and heads up the steps, disappearing into  the bedroom...Jack shakes his head, frustrated.  Then,  he feels something licking at his hand... He looks down and sees Lucy standing next to him,  wagging her tail, looking up at Jack with an В“IВ’ve  gotta goВ” look on her face.  Jack heaves a sigh,  then... JACK (CONTВ’D) CВ’mon, Lucy, maybe one of  us can get a little  relief tonight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads the dog toward the front door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is walking Lucy.  He passes a house that looks  familiar to him.  Then he sees it... ...the name В“THOMPSONВ” etched on the mailbox... ItВ’s the Thompson house, now sans the garish Christmas  decorations, a drying Christmas tree tied up on the  curb, ready to be picked up as garbage... Jack stops, pulling the dog back, looking up at the  house... He sees a light on in the upstairs bedroom...the faint  outline of a woman reading by the window... EVELYN THOMPSON... Jack looks around, sees the street is empty, then  nudges the dog, leading her up the path to the house. He gets to the front door...moves his hand up to the  doorbell...but itВ’s a tentative move...he keeps it  there a moment, perched at the button...but for some  reason he canВ’t bring himself to push it... He looks down the street, toward his own house, then to  the window upstairs.  Finally, he turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling the leash) CВ’mon, girl, letВ’s go  home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door opens and Jack walks in with Lucy on a  leash, his face red from the cold outside. He gives the dog a pat on the rump, then takes off his  coat, hanging it and the leash on a hook by the door... He walks through the quiet house, into the living room,  rubbing his hands together to warm them up.

dialogues.speaker: CHAPTER ELEVEN
dialogues.text: He goes over to a glass bar stand and pours himself a  scotch, taking a sip, letting the alcohol warm him... He strolls through the room, looking at some of the  family photos framed and hanging on the wall, focusing  on his own face in the pictures, studying the  expressions... He moves to a pile of video tapes sitting on a shelf,  marked with titles like, В“Trip to Yosemite, В‘96" and  В“JoshВ’s 1st Birthday.В”  He runs his fingers along the  tapes, stopping at one marked, В“Jack Singing.В”  His  eyes linger there a moment... He puts his drink down and pops the tape in the VCR...

dialogues.speaker: ON TV
dialogues.text: ItВ’s a party for KateВ’s birthday thrown at the KramersВ house...same crowd of people as the Christmas party,  cheesy В“Happy BirthdayВ” decorations. The image jerks up and down, surveying the crowd... Bill Kramer at the piano, playing some light cocktail  music ...Kate talking with a group of friends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Bill, this thing  is an antique.  DonВ’t you  even have image  stabilization?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill stops playing and looks up at Arnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hundred bucks at Best  Buy, Arn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then...Jack comes into frame, a confident smile on his  face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And everyone knows image  stabilization is for the  weak...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is jarred by the image of himself on the video... Jack on TV...he smiles as Kate walks into frame, easily  putting an arm around Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Jack, itВ’s your wifeВ’s  birthday, got anything to  say to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate) ItВ’s your birthday?   Today?  WhatВ’s your  name?  Where were you  born?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.  YouВ’re my  wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slaps him playfully on the arm... JACK (CONTВ’D) I do have one thing I  wanna say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks at him expectantly.  Then... JACK (CONTВ”D) (singing to her) Oh those fingers in my  hair, that sly come  hither stare, strips my  conscience bare, itВ’s  witchcraft...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack doesnВ’t have the greatest voice in the world but  heВ’s not the least bit self-conscious...and Kate seems  to like it, thereВ’s a twinkle in her eye...some of the  guests focus their attention on Jack and Kate.  Jack winces, embarrassed, as he watches himself sing... JACK (CONTВ’D) ...and IВ’ve got no  defense for it, that heat  is too intense for it,  what good would common  sense for it do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Kramer still at the piano, chimes in with the  basic chords for В“Witchcract,В” sounding it out as he  goes along... JACK (CONTВ’D) ...В‘Cause itВ’s  witchcraft, wicked  witchcraft...and although  I know itВ’s strictly  taboo...when you rouse  the need in me, my heart  says yes indeed in me,  proceed with what youВ’re  leadinВ’ me to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera catches the reactions of guests in the  crowd... the women, smiles on their faces, wrapped up  in the romance of the moment.  Envy on the menВ’s faces  as they watch Jack serenade his wife... A musical interlude from Bill as Jack takes off his  jacket...some HOOTS and HOLLERS from the crowd...Arnie  captures the image of Kate whistling at her husband... Arnie follows with the camera as Jack strolls in front  of the gathered guests...  JACK (CONTВ’D) ItВ’s such an ancient  pitch, but one that IВ’d  never switch, there ainВ’t  no nicer witch than  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack watches himself move gracefully.  But itВ’s no  longer embarrassment on his face, itВ’s fascination... Back in the video, the camera catches Evelyn Thompson  watching longingly as Jack moves back toward  Kate...Evelyn canВ’t take it anymore, she abruptly turns  and walks toward the kitchen... Jack raises an eyebrow... In the video...Jack approaches Kate, she couldnВ’t have  a more delighted look on her face.  He picks up the  verse... JACK (CONTВ’D) В‘Cause itВ’s witchcraft,  that koo koo  witchcraft...and although  I know itВ’s strictly  taboo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pans across the crowd, even the men are  getting into it, focused on Jack as he sings lovingly,  unashamed, to his wife...Nick Careli mouths the words  along with Jack, almost as if heВ’s studying him,  revering him... Jack watches the TV, seeing Nick do this...maybe he  underestimated his alter ego... On the video...Jack staring into KateВ’s eyes... JACK (CONTВ’D) ...when you rouse the  need in me, my heart says  yes indeed to me, proceed  with what youВ’re leadinВ’  me to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Kate exchange a sexy smile... JACK (CONTВ’D) ItВ’s such an ancient  pitch, but one that IВ’d  never switch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack kisses her on the lips...HOOTS and HOLLERS from  the crowd. JACK (CONTВ’D) В‘Cause thereВ’s no nicer  witch than you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate brushes a hand across JackВ’s face... Smash cut to Jack watching this...seeing the  connection, the heat between them...coveting it... Back to the video...the music building...the crowd  completely in the palm of JackВ’s hand... JACK (CONTВ’D) ...than you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera closes in on Jack and Kate as the music  builds to a crescendo... JACK (CONTВ’D) ...than you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little musical flourish from Bill as the crowd breaks  out into huge CHEERS and APPLAUSE... Jack, watching this other version of himself in the video the center of attention, larger than life, focused on Kat Back on video... JACK (CONTВ’D) (speaking quietly  to Kate) Happy Birthday  sweetheart...I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate leans over, giving Jack a deep kiss...OOHS and  AHHS from the crowd...but Jack and Kate are in their  own little world... Jack continues to watch himself on the video, his smile  fading, becoming a look of realization...then loss... A tear at the corner of his eye... The SOUND fades in JackВ’s head as the action in the  video continues... HeВ’s left standing there...silent, still...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy licking JackВ’s face.  Jack pushes the dog  away...as... The ALARM RINGS.  Kate pushes the button to stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy) Time to get up, honey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack obliges without question, getting out of bed,  putting on a robe and slippers and exiting, still  practically half-asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks into the kitchen. He turns on the Mr. Coffee, gets a bottle from the  fridge, throws it in the microwave, removes it, and  heads upstairs. 74        INT. JOSHВ’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS ...into JoshВ’s room.  Josh is wide awake, standing up  in his crib, like a prisoner in a cell. Jack gives him the bottle, pats his head perfunctorily,  and then walks out of the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and back into the bedroom to find Kate, sitting on  the bed, a wrapped present in front of her and a wide  smile on her face. Jack stops, raising an eyebrow at the gift.  He looks  behind, as if to ask whether itВ’s for him, then back to  Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Anniversary,  honey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terror on JackВ’s face. KATE (CONTВ’D) (pushing the gift  forward) Before you do whatever  crazy stunt youВ’ve got  planned I want you to  open mine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack musters up a smile, then approaches the gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, open it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hesitates, then begins unwrapping the package,  revealing... ...a suit, similar in color and style to the Zegna  suit... KATE (CONTВ’D) I found it at an outlet  store.  I know itВ’s a  knock-off, but I think  itВ’ll look great on  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examining the label) Zeena...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is overcome with emotion...Yes, itВ’s a ZEENA, but  this is probably the nicest thing anyoneВ’s ever done  for him... JACK (CONTВ’D)  (tearing up) You really are  incredible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy it, sweetheart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at KateВ’s expectant face, suddenly  remembering how truly screwed he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YouВ’re probably expecting  something from me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HeВ’s sweating bullets...watching as Kate gets a quizzica look on her face... JACK (CONTВ’D) HereВ’s the thing.  I  really hadnВ’t planned on  giving you your...uh...  anniversary gift until  tonight. (an uncomfortable  smile) You know, anniversaryВ’s  good all day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking  about?  You never wait  all day.  You can barely  wait until itВ’s light  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.  Kate looks at him like sheВ’s looking into his  soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stands there, silent. KATE (CONTВ’D) You actually forgot our  anniversary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’ll fix it.  IВ’ll go out  right now and get you  something.  IВ’ll make it  right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That didnВ’t help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding back  the tears) Jesus, Jack...Is this  where we are now?  Is  this our marriage?   Suddenly IВ’m the wife who  has to drop hints two  weeks before her  anniversary so her  husband doesnВ’t fuck it  up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sees a tear run down her face...a pang of guilt on  his...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please donВ’t cry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate wipes the tear away but they just keep coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head,  crying) I donВ’t want to be that,  Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack approaches her, holding out a hand but Kate pushes  it away, gets up and walks toward the bathroom... Jack is left standing alone, holding KateВ’s gift...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack emerges from the house, steps out onto the porch  for some air... He shakes his head, a mixture of frustration and self- pity on his face. He notices AnnieВ’s bike leaning against the side of the  porch, and the bell that Cash gave him sitting on its  handle bar. He takes a step toward it, and gives the bell a gentle  RING ...he looks around, as if heВ’s expecting someone  to appear ...but thereВ’s no one.  He RINGS the bell  again, louder this time, really trying to attract  someoneВ’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CВ’mon...cВ’mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  Finally, he lifts the bike up in the air,  RINGING the bell with everything heВ’s got... JACK (CONTВ’D) (shouting to the  sky) CВ’mon, goddamnit, how was  I supposed to know the  date of their  anniversary!?  I never  married her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back...Annie in the doorway...looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly) Put the bicycle back on  the ground...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack turns and sees her, gently lowering the bicycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is mixing a glass of chocolate milk.  Annie, arms  folded, is waiting expectantly.  He finishes, sliding  the glass to her. She takes a long sip, puts the glass down, a chocolate  milk mustache on her lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad...I shoulda  warned you.  Dad always  does something really  special for their  anniversary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One year he had a solar  system named after her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DonВ’t you think thatВ’s a  little gimmicky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom liked it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack raises an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe thereВ’s a jewelry  store back at the mall.   I could get her a pair of  earrings or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThatВ’s good but...you did  forget the anniversary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  ThatВ’s a major  oversight... (thinking aloud) So if IВ’m Kate...I canВ’t  really afford the finer  things, my husbandВ’s  career is a crushing  disappointment to me,  IВ’m trapped in suburbia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then... JACK (CONTВ’D) Did he ever take her to  the City?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie smiles, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YouВ’re really gettinВ’ the  hang of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a look of confidence comes over JackВ’s face.   For the first time, he seems like a man in control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie is sitting on the bed watching her mother get  dressed. Kate, wearing a silky slip, walks out of her closet  carrying two dresses on hangers, a red one and a sexy  little black one. Kate holds out the two dresses to Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie thinks about it for a moment, taking it very  seriously...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate nods.  SheВ’s about to put it on when she looks at  Annie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FightingВ’s a part of it,  Annie.  You know that,  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m not worried, Mom.   HeВ’s still learning our  ways...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks at her with a raised eyebrow, then nods.   ItВ’s true.  She puts down the dress and holds out a  hand to Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CВ’mere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate leads her to the makeup table, then opens a  lipstick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate nods then applies some red lipstick to AnnieВ’s  lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now go like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate rubs her lips together, showing Annie how to do  it.  Annie mimics her Mom, then Kate looks at her В–  AnnieВ’s beaming. KATE (CONTВ’D) YouВ’re gonna break a lot  of hearts, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile from Annie... Pull back to reveal...Jack standing at the door,  watching ...appreciating the kind of mother Kate is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, elegant French restaurant hidden on a tree- lined lower Manhattan street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is wearing the suit Kate gave him.  ItВ’s not a  Zegna, but he looks pretty damn good. He leads Kate toward the cloak room at this intimate  restaurant... He helps her off with her coat.  KateВ’s wearing the  sexy little black dress and we can immediately see its  effectiveness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A charmed smile from Kate as she hands Jack her coat. Jack hands the coats over to the COAT CHECK GIRL... JACK (CONTВ’D) (instinctively) Thanks, Catherine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack fakes a SNEEZE, trying to cover up...Kate gives  him a pat on the back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes Kate by the arm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads her to the main room. She looks out at the room, elegant tables, French  country decor, a PIANIST playing Cole Porter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly to Jack) Jack...can we afford all  this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WhatВ’s the difference?   IВ’m taking my baby out  for our anniversary, damn  the costs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you even know  about this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s caught for a moment.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnie... (insistent) Arnie.  HeВ’ll throw you a  curve ball once in a  while, thatВ’s for sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack puts his arm around her and kisses her on the  cheek...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Kate sit at a secluded table, a WAITER  standing next to them.  JackВ’s not even looking at the m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WeВ’ll have the tureen of  quail breast with  shiitake mushrooms to  start, then the veal  medallions in raspberry  truffle sauce and the sea  scallops with pureed  artichoke hearts...sea  scallops, North of the  Caspian...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks at Jack, a mixture of confusion and awe on  her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, sir.  And may  I say those are all  excellent selections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may... (perusing the  wine list) Also, weВ’ll have a bottle  of Lafite, 1982.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate reaches over and pulls down the wine list, reading  it upside down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s five hundred and  fifty dollars, Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wince from Jack...for a moment there it was almost  perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a glass of red wine  for each of us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter nods, then walks toward the kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so not off the  hook yet, slick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But IВ’m gettinВ’ close, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A noncommittal nod from Kate.  Then Jack notices her  look over at the pianist, drawn in by the music. JACK (CONTВ’D) You want to dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A puzzled look from Kate.  ThereВ’s nobody else  dancing.  There isnВ’t even much room to dance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I donВ’t think thereВ’s  dancing here, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack gets up and holds out a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure there is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks around again, then she smiles. Kate rises, taking his hand.  Jack takes her in his  arms, swaying slowly in the limited amount of space,  confident and self-assured. The pianist looks up, smiling, appreciating their role  in this romantic moment. Kate moves with Jack, following his lead comfortably.   They look good together...in sync with each other... People are watching them...some of the men are  impressed, others are scoffing, but the women are  clearly charmed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to  Jack) Pretty good for a tire  salesman from Jersey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack flashes her his most charming smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have my moments...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue to dance, in a world of their own...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Kate at the table enjoying a gourmet meal.   Jack holds out a fork with a piece of veal for Kate.   She takes a bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm... (spearing a scallop) ...here, try one of  these...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack takes a scallop from KateВ’s fork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (savoring the scallop)  God I missed that  taste...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate laughs. JACK (CONTВ’D) Why are you laughing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate shoots him a look of curiosity.  Jack looks back  at her, sees the trust in her face...He puts down his  fork. JACK (CONTВ’D) I need to tell you  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it may help us  but thereВ’s a slight  chance it could make  things worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears the seriousness in his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now IВ’m worried...just  say it.  Whatever it is  weВ’ll deal with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.  Jack searches his mind for the right words.   Then... JACK (CONTВ’D) I feel like IВ’m living  someone elseВ’s life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks to her, expecting the worst.  But she just  nods reassuringly.  He continues... JACK (CONTВ’D) I used to be so sure  about everything, you  know?  I knew exactly who  I was and what I wanted.   Then one morning I woke  up and suddenly it was  all different...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worse, you mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Well, maybe a few  things.  But mostly just  different...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack lets out a small smile.  Now heВ’s the one whoВ’s  reassuring Kate. JACK (CONTВ’D) I never used to be like  this, Kate.  I had it all  figured out.  No doubts,  no regrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now...I donВ’t...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her, staring into her eyes, almost  desperate for understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A raised eyebrow from Jack. KATE (CONTВ’D) I think itВ’s good to be a  little unsure about who  you are.  ItВ’s very  human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you always seem so  certain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CВ’mon, Jack, you think  there arenВ’t mornings  when I wake up and wonder  what the hell IВ’m doing  in New Jersey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThatВ’s a big one for me,  too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My office is a dump, I  answer my own phone...and  youВ’ve seen my pay check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your pay check is a  disgrace to pay checks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean yes, I help people  that need it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess...some of them  are probably faking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a laugh, then...) God, sometimes I think it  would be so nice not to  have to stretch ground  beef or maybe drive a car  with a CD player...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles, right there with her. KATE (CONTВ’D) Imagine having a life  where everything was  easy...where you asked  for things and people  just brought them to  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s wonderful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate laughs, nodding. A pause, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think about it, too,  Jack.  I do.  I think  about the kind of person  IВ’d be if I hadnВ’t  married you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s as if sheВ’s inside his head.  They stay like this  for a moment, looking into each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops a moment, considering.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I realize IВ’ve just  erased the things in my  life IВ’m most sure  about.  You, the kids...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you sure about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks into KateВ’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m sure that right now  thereВ’s nowhere IВ’d  rather be than here with  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles at Jack, a loving, secure smile.  ItВ’s been  a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mini-van parked outside a small brownstone right on  the square.  ItВ’s like something out of a Henry James  novel... charming, meticulously maintained, elegant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Jack, carrying Kate in his arms,  enters... Jack puts Kate down and she takes in the room, antique  furniture...itВ’s like walking into another world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack smiles as he opens a champagne bottle sitting on a  silver ice bucket... KATE (CONTВ’D) You know champagne makes  me do crazy things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pouring) IВ’ll just full yours up  to the top. (handing her a  glass) Happy anniversary,  sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles, clinking her glass with JackВ’s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I donВ’t know how you did  it, hoss, but you pulled  it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m out of the doghouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate saunters into the bedroom, looking at the king- size poster bed, feeling the down quilt.  Jack follows  her... KATE (CONTВ’D) (turning to him) You may even get lucky  tonight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate kisses him...when their lips separate, we can see  the powerful effect it has on him. Jack looks deep into her eyes, stroking her hair, lost  in her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YouВ’re so...beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already told you you  were gonna get lucky,  Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss again, a long soulful kiss.  Then... Jack pulls back, a look of realization on his face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god, all this time...I  never stopped loving  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a wide smile)  ThatВ’s all I wanted to  hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him, their bodies intertwined...hands  caressing ...more and more passionate...then reaches  behind her to the light.  The room goes dark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning sun streams onto Jack and Kate in bed... Kate, in JackВ’s arms, her head on his chest, a  contented smile on her face... JackВ’s eyes open...adjust to the light.  He looks over  at Kate. ThereВ’s something different in his eyes...something  deeper.  Jack smiles...a broad, В“IВ’m in loveВ” kind of  smile. Kate stirs, gently stroking JackВ’s chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm...Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate lifts her head, turning to face Jack. KATE (CONTВ’D) I feel like I should give  you money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack laughs. KATE (CONTВ’D) I mean, my god, Jack you  were always good but  this...this was... like a  porno movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate lays her head back on JackВ’s chest, looking at  Washington Square through the window. KATE (CONTВ’D) I could stay here  forever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I donВ’t think IВ’d fight  you on that one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate lifts her head and looks at him expectantly.  They  kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mini-van passes a sign that reads, В“Welcome to  Teaneck.В”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie walking through the downstairs of the house,  practicing her violin...itВ’s a noise bordering on  MUSIC, but not quite... She walks into the kitchen where... Jack stands at the counter in his robe, reading the  Newark Star Ledger and drinking a cup of coffee. He lowers the paper, watches Annie with a smile as she  strolls through the room playing her violin badly...he  goes back to his paper. 89        INT.
