JACKВ’S CLOSET - MINUTES LATER Jack, still singing, donning his Dockers and short- sleeve oxford...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door of the Campbell House... Jack emerges in his work clothes, putting his coat on,  a bagel in his mouth... He disappears from frame, the screen door closing  slowly behind him... In a moment...Kate appears at the door, a cup of coffee  in her hand...she follows Jack with her eyes as he  heads to the car. Then...a smile from Kate... In a moment...Jack returns to frame and heads straight  into KateВ’s arms... ...a passionate kiss as she leans against the door  post...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile from Jack as she pats him on the ass and sends  him on his way... 90        EXT. BIG EDВ’S - AFTERNOON Jack, pointing to a stack of radials, is standing with  a MAN (40s) wearing a pale blue leisure suit and a pair  of high top Nike Air Jordans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the money, theyВ’re  hands down the best  radial we carry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking, then...) Okay, IВ’ll take them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wonВ’t regret it... (shouting to Tommy) Tommy!  Set Mr. Conlin up  with four B.F. Goodrich  G-Force T/AВ’s... (looking the man  over) ...and give him ten  percent off for having  the best costume...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, a black ROLLS ROYCE SILVER SERAPH pulls into  the lot, its front left tire riding on the rim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over P.A. system) Jack, Kate on line two!   Jack pick up two!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack turns toward the door, but then looks curiously  back at the Rolls...something familiar about it... Then...Peter Lassiter gets out of the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking out to Jack) KateВ’s on two, Jack. (on seeing the Rolls) Nice ride...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at Lassiter) If youВ’re into that kind  of conspicuous  consumption...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to handle  him?  I think IВ’m  ready...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over P.A. system) Jack!  Kate still holding  on line two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure...be careful, he  looks like a tough  negotiator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks inside... 91        INT. BIG EDВ’S TIRES - CONTINUOUS ...but heВ’s still focused on Lassiter through the  window, canВ’t take his eyes off him... He gets to the phone...sees the light for line two  blinking ...he looks back outside, sees Kenny approach  Lassiter... ...back to the blinking phone light...he picks up the  phone... But canВ’t bring himself to hit the blinking light.   Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Estelle, into  intercom) Tell Kate IВ’ll call her  back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) It sounded pretty  important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) IВ’m with a customer.   IВ’ll call her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his hand away from the phone and walks back  outside the store...

dialogues.speaker: CHAPTER THIRTEEN
dialogues.text: 92        EXT. BIG EDВ’S TIRES - CONTINUOUS ...towards Kenny and Lassiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kenny) I seem to have had some  kind of blow out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack approaches, tapping Kenny on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why donВ’t you let me take  this one, Kenny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny nods then heads back inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter Lassiter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly. IВ’ve seen you  on CNBC. (with a smile) You look taller in real  life...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 93        INT. BIG EDВ’S TIRED, JACKВ’S OFFICE - LATE Jack leaning back in his chair, behind the desk of his  cluttered, cramped office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...truth is, Mintz was so  busy timing his wifeВ’s  breathing he didnВ’t see  that MedTech needed  Global more than the  other way around.  Ten  days, two weeks tops,  they wouldВ’ve approached  you with an offer, and  IВ’d bet anything it  wouldВ’ve been thirty  billion, not twenty  nine... (a knowing smile) Problem was, Peter, you  had a pussycat running  the show. What you needed  was a rottweiler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lassiter, sitting on the little chair across from Jack,  an intrigued look on his face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Well, IВ’m impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile from Jack. LASSITER (CONTВ’D) I really am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack savors the moment, until... LASSITER (CONTВ’D) So, about my car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HeВ’s jarred back to reality, a little crestfallen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. WeВ’re going to  have to special order  that tire. ItВ’ll be  ready in about two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lassiter nods, then takes a business card out of his  wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has my office address  on it... (thinking, then...) Why donВ’t you drop it off  yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile from Jack.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 94        INT. CAMPBELL HOUSE, JACKВ’S BEDROOM - LATE NIG Kate, sound asleep in bed... Pan across to Jack, his eyes wide open, lost in  thought... 95        INT. BIG EDВ’S, JACKВ’S OFFICE - DAY Jack wearing his Zeena suit, sitting behind his desk,  distracted, as he listens to HECTOR, 40s, the  GUATEMALEN MECHANIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I say to her, Margarita,  we already have four kids,  why do we need more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is shaking his leg anxiously under the desk as he  eyes the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HECTOR (CONTВ’D) But she say she want an  even number. I say four  is an even number! But  she say she want six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack checks his watch... HECTOR (CONTВ’D) I tell her, Margarita, I  just got my green card,  I like to sit back and  rest a little bit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Hector...do I usually  listen to your personal  problems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Jack, all the time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack nods, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I have some business  that I have to take care  of in the city so IВ’m  leaving early... (getting up) My advice to you...follow  your dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pulling up to the building in LassiterВ’s Rolls... He gets out of the car, walks to the building, feeling  good, confident, stopping to gaze up at the  skyscraper...he breathes in deeply, then heads  inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters, instinctively tossing the car keys to the  SECURITY GUARD...the guard looks at him like heВ’s  crazy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Lassiter walk together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...weВ’re really more of a  boutique operation, as  you can see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But youВ’re not interested  in boutique dollars... (a smile) I get it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk into... 98        INT. ALAN MINTZВ’S OUTER OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Past the assistantВ’s desk... MINTZВ’S ASSISTANT (seeing Lassiter) HeВ’s expecting you, Mr.  Lassiter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lassiter doesnВ’t even slow down... 99        INT. ALAN MINTZВ’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS ItВ’s JackВ’s old office but you wouldnВ’t know it from  the decor...lots of country pine, a fabric sofa, and a  play pen where the bar used to be.  Jack enters,  immediately struck by the difference...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mintz) Alan, this is Jack  Campbell...the one I was  telling you about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mintz, a confident look on his face, gets up from the  desk and goes to shake JackВ’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appropriately  deferential) Mr. Mintz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, call me Alan. We  try to cultivate a casual  atmosphere around here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: play pen) I can see that, Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chuckle from Mintz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have kids, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitating, then...) Uh...actually, yes. Two... good ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another laugh from Mintz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThatВ’s great... (gesturing to  the sofa) Why donВ’t you have a seat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack nods, sits down on the plush sofa, Mintz and  Lassiter take the chairs. ALAN (CONTВ’D) So, Peter mentioned that  you were an avid CNBC  watcher but didnВ’t say  whether you had any  actual Wall Street  experience?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s a little taken aback by the question, not  realizing he was walking into an interview... He crosses his legs, trying to get comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a sales associate,  at E.F. Hutton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A broker? Really. And now  youВ’re in the tire  business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThatВ’s right. And auto  supply...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. The retail end, I  understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack nods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...we actually get about  sixty percent of our  business from automotive  service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I ask what kind of  sales you did last year?  Ballpark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did one point seven  million in total revenue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh...one point seven.   And what do you project for  this year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pauses, analyzing the situation...the patronizing  questions, the smirk on MintzВ’s face... ALAN (CONTВ’D) Any thoughts at all on  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jack stares into their faces, he realizes the extent  of his handicap... ALAN (CONTВ’D) Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, takes a moment, looking at Mintz and Lassiter  then ...a confident smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Alan, I think weВ’re  gonna have a banner year.   Sales are up almost  twenty percent in the  first quarter and we just  landed a major trucking  company account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. So youВ’re  projecting what, a tad  over two million?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gleam in JackВ’s eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThatВ’s right. And that  would make us number one  in our market... (getting up) You mind if I stand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A raised eyebrow from Mintz. Mintz and Lassiter follow Jack with their eyes as he  crosses the room to the desk, pours himself a glass of  water... JACK (CONTВ’D) Look, I know our paltry  little two million in  sales is about what you  spend on office supplies  in a year.  And I know  some regional trucking  company account is  nothing compared to a  sixty billion dollar  merger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m not trying to knock  the tire business, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a confident chuckle) ItВ’s okay, Alan. I get it.  IВ’m in your shoes, IВ’m  thinking exactly the same  thing...but hereВ’s the  thing. Business is  business.  Wall Street,  Main Street, itВ’s all  just a bunch of people  getting up in the morning,  trying to figure out how  the hell theyВ’re gonna  send their kids to  college.  ItВ’s just  people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s confidence is throwing Mintz off, but Lassiter  appears intrigued... JACK (CONTВ’D) And I know people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m sure you do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intervening) LetВ’s let the man have  his say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mintz covers his embarrassment with a smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mintz) Take you, for instance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive) What about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drink about sixteen  Diet Cokes a day. YouВ’re  an excellent father, but  you feel guilty about the  time you spend away from  home. You drink bourbon,  but you offer your  clients scotch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks around the office then back to Mintz. JACK (CONTВ’D) And your wife decorated  this office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A laugh from Lassiter as Mintz sits there stewing, a  caught look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He certainly has your  number, Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Lassiter) YouВ’re a little tougher,  Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A raised eyebrow from Lassiter, but heВ’s game... JACK (CONTВ’D) For one thing, you like  expensive things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling proudly)  ThatВ’s easy. YouВ’ve seen  my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a chuckle) Okay...you smoke Hoyo de  Monterreys. YouВ’re a  scotch man, single malt,  not because itВ’s trendy  but because youВ’ve been  doing it for forty years,  and you stay with what  works. You have two great  loves in your life, your  horses and this company.   You wept openly the day  the Dow hit ten thousand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LassiterВ’s impressed. JACK (CONTВ’D) And youВ’re a man who  prides himself on finding  talent in unusual  places...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? And how would you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because IВ’m here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Lassiter...nodding his head. Mintz, a plastered-on  smile. JACK (CONTВ’D) IВ’m prepared to do  anything it takes to get  this job. Start anywhere  you need me to start.   IВ’ll park cars if I  to... (into LassiterВ’s  eyes) The biggest part of  judging character is  knowing yourself. And I  know this, I can do this  job. Give me a chance,  Peter, I wonВ’t let you  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lassiter returns JackВ’s gaze with equal intensity. In a  moment, he turns to Mintz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mintz) Alan, why donВ’t you show  Jack around a bit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’d love to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Alan walking side by side down the hallway...  EMPLOYEES passing them by, greeting Mintz, Mintz waving  back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) ...thatВ’s our war room.   We did seven major deals  last year, three of them  hostile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not particularly  impressed) Seven.  Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn a corner, coming into a deserted section of  the corridor. Mintz stops, turning to Jack.  Jack returns MintzВ’s  gaze with a quizzical look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LetВ’s cut the shit, huh  Campbell? What, did you go  through his wallet or  something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s a little taken aback. ALAN (CONTВ’D) No matter. That circus  act back there may have  dazzled Lassiter  momentarily but it  doesnВ’t do shit forme.   Even if you get this job,  which I highly doubt, let  me warn you, Lassiter  loses interest in his pet  projects very quickly.  IВ’m in the big office  because IВ’ve proved  myself to him year after  year and nobody is going  to come in here and start  turning the old manВ’s  head. Especially not some  tire salesman from New  Jersey. So you watch  yourself and stay away  from Lassiter, and maybe,  just maybe, IВ’ll keep you  on after he gets tired of  you. Do we understand  each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stands there, staring at Mintz, silent,  expressionless. ALAN (CONTВ’D) Do we?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, a broad smile from Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, you really are  different, arenВ’t you... (nodding) I mean...wow...I am  impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now itВ’s MintzВ’s turn to look quizzical. JACK (CONTВ’D) Good for you. Why shouldnВ’t  you protect whatВ’s yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I donВ’t think youВ’re hearing  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, IВ’m hearing you, Alan.   ThatВ’s not the problem.   The problem is that what  you think is yours, is  really mine.  And I donВ’t  care how low on the totem  pole I start, I will get  it back... (poking him in  the chest) So do yourself a favor and  donВ’t get too attached to  that view because sometime  soon, maybe very soon, you and your French country  antiques, your chintz sofa,  and your little play pen  are gonna be moving out of  that office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack smiles at Alan one more time, then turns... JACK (CONTВ’D) Oh, and by the way, you  try selling tires for a  living.  I promise you,  youВ’d starve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack heads down the corridor, whistling a happy tune,  leaving Mintz standing there, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A double door opens and Jack leads Kate into this huge  duplex.  Kate looks around, taking the place in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Xanadu...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is incredible...marble floors, architectural  lines, high tech fixtures, elegant modern furniture... itВ’s striking but not at all homey like the Jersey  house. JACK (CONTВ’D) Pretty incredible, isnВ’t  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s like a museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack nods. KATE (CONTВ’D) (turning to Jack) So whatВ’s the big  surprise? You didnВ’t  rent this place for  the weekend, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is a perk,  Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A perk for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A company called P.K.  Lassiter and Associates  Investment House uses it  to attract new  executives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KateВ’s confused. JACK (CONTВ’D) YouВ’re talking to their  new Vice President of  Mergers and Acquisitions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking  about, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m going into arbitrage,  honey.  Turns out I have  a knack for it.  IВ’ll be  making two hundred grand  a year plus a hefty bonus and thatВ’s just to  start.  And, we can live  in this apartment  practically rent free for  as long as we want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack measures her reaction. ItВ’s not good... JACK (CONTВ’D) We can finally afford to  move back into the city.   In style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate just looks at him, in shock. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I donВ’t think so. This  is going to be a better  life for all of us,  honey.  WeВ’ll put Annie  and Josh in private  schools...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie goes to a great  school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m talking about the  best schools in the  country here, Kate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, what could you  possibly be thinking?   What about my job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is New York City,  itВ’s like the needy  people capital of the  world.  Those Jersey  clients of yours arenВ’t a  tenth as pathetic as the  ones you could get  here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) I canВ’t believe you want  to move back into the  city.  I thought the  reason we left was  because we didnВ’t want to  raise the kids here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is the center of  the universe.  If I were  living in Roman times, I  would live in Rome, where  else?  Today, America is  the Roman Empire and New  York is Rome itself.  John Lennon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off)  Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s starting to struggle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, IВ’m detecting a  kind of funky tension  here...We donВ’t have to  live in this apartment.  I donВ’t need this...IВ’ll  commute...IВ’ll drive to  work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s back on his heels...seeing his dream picked  apart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In traffic?  ItВ’s over an  hour each way?  ThatВ’s  almost three hours a  day.  When are you going  to see the kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HeВ’s frustrated...he pauses a moment to gather  himself. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate. YouВ’re not  understanding me. IВ’m  talking about a great  life.  A perfect life.   Everything we pictured  when we were young. The  whole package. You said  it yourself, life has  thrown us surprises, and  so we made sacrifices.   But now I can finally get  us back on track...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sad chuckle from Kate. JACK (CONTВ’D) I can do that.  I want to  do that.  For all of us.   I need to do that as a  man... (imploring her) Think about it.  No more  lousy restaurants, no  more clipping coupons, no  more shoveling snow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get a goddamn snow  blower!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s taken aback by the intensity of her tone. KATE (CONTВ’D) DonВ’t get a new career  without even telling me.   DonВ’t take Annie out of a  school she loves.  DonВ’t  move us out of a house  weВ’ve become a family  in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate stands there, wounded... KATE (CONTВ’D) (quietly) DonВ’t do that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, youВ’re making this  into something itВ’s not.  This isnВ’t a referendum  on our lives, Kate. ItВ’s  a step forward... (appealing to her) DonВ’t you see?  IВ’m  talking about us finally  having a life other  people envy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.  Kate looks him in the eye В– a deep, piercing  look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They already do envy us,  Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate picks up her bag and walks out of the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: 103        INT. ANNIEВ’S ROOM - NIGHT Annie is in a nightgown, practicing her violin. Jack  walks in. ItВ’s all he can do to hold back cringing at the missed  notes. Annie finishes the piece, lowering the bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Had A Little Lamb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. A classic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie starts PLAYING again as Jack looks at the  dresser. She has 20 or so family photos lined up and  down its sides... Jack studies them...in every one JackВ’s face is totally  contented.  Jack studies them, looking at his own face. Annie lowers the bow, watching him... Jack turns to her. JACK (CONTВ’D) Please donВ’t stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, then starts PLAYING again.  He turns back  to the pictures...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack...standing in front of the desk, nursing a drink. He looks at LassiterВ’s business card, sitting on the  surface of the desk... He gazes around the room...his eyes coming to rest on a  bookshelf...a book... He moves toward it...looking at its spine...itВ’s a  tattered copy of VonnegutВ’s В“CatВ’s Cradle.В”  He pulls it off the shelf, thereВ’s something inside...a  bookmark... ...a PAN AM ticket jacket sleeve... ...inside...a boarding pass...В”From: London/Heathrow,  To: New York/JFK, 10/4/87.В” He looks at it...somethingВ’s not right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From London to New York...? (looking up) I came back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then...a NOISE... Jack turns and sees Kate walking into the doorway,  standing there...She sees Jack holding the Pan Am  ticket sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our finest moment,  right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quizzical look from Jack. KATE (CONTВ’D) When you got on that  plane I was sure it was  over.  I left the airport  afraid IВ’d never see you  again.  And then you  showed up the very next  day... (a wistful smile) That was a good  surprise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues into the room, leaning against a  bookshelf. KATE (CONTВ’D) I think about you on that  plane, about what must  have been going through  your mind...you sitting  there imagining our life  together, our life  apart...I think about the  decision you made...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack watches her as she lets out a small sigh. KATE (CONTВ’D) Maybe I was being naive  but I believed weВ’d grow  old together in this  house.  That weВ’d spend  holidays here, have g randchildren visit us  here.  I had this image  of us all grey and  wrinkly, me working in  the garden, you  repainting the deck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles gently as she pictures this. KATE (CONTВ’D) Things change, right?   People change... (pausing) If you need this, Jack, I  mean really need this, I  will take these children  from a life they love,  and take myself from the  only home weВ’ve ever  shared, and move wherever  you need to go.  IВ’ll do  that because I love  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words are like a warm embrace for Jack... KATE (CONTВ’D) I love you, Jack. And   thatВ’s more important to  me than our address...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles lovingly at Jack...she walks over to him,  kisses him gently on the forehead. KATE (CONTВ’D) I choose us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and heads out of the room, leaving him there,  the boarding pass still in hand, staring lovingly at  her as she goes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks into the room... The lights are off, Kate already in bed sleeping. He undresses for bed, unable to take his eyes off Kate. Finally, he lifts the covers and climbs into bed next  to her, moving closer to her, putting an arm around  her, drawing her in... In her sleep, Kate nestles in JackВ’s embrace.  He  savors the feeling, then closes his eyes as... They lay there...side by side...together...a single  person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning light streams into the room.  Kate opens  her eyes.  JackВ’s not in bed.  A look of curiosity. Then, she hears LAUGHTER from outside. She goes over to the window...opens the blinds...  revealing... Jack in the backyard, LAUGHING with joy, playing in the  snow with Annie and Josh. Kate watches...a satisfied smile sweeping across her  face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Jack reaches out and snags Annie...she CACKLES in  delight... The three of them fall over onto the soft white snow... The laughter from the kids is uncontrollable, JackВ’s  joy is just as palpable... Finally, Annie stops laughing and grabs Jack around the  neck, hugging his tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering in  JackВ’s ear) I knew youВ’d come back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks over to a utility shelf, fishing around  until he finds a bag of rock salt...he grabs it, sees  itВ’s empty... And then he hears it...the sound of a BICYCLE BELL  RINGING, echoing through the room. A shudder passes through his body... He turns and sees Annie at the open garage door,  sitting on her bike, ringing the BELL. ItВ’s an eerie moment for Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a curious look) Ringing my bell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On JackВ’s anxious face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Jack...crouched down in an aisle of this local  convenience store...checking out the bags of rock  salt... He looks at the price tag on one of the bags...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four ninety nine?! ItВ’s just  salt for godВ’s sake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the entrance to the store...the door opens, a YOUNG  GIRL, 17, enters, an average suburban teenager... She glances at a fashion magazine, picks up a package  of gum... From the POV of the cashier, we see the girl approach  the counter... On Jack, crouched down in the aisle. He grabs a bag of  salt from the shelf, when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThatВ’ll be sixty five cents,  little angel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack registers the voice...he rises slowly, looking  over to the front counter...where he sees... Cash, dressed in a typical chain convenience store  uniform, ringing up the teenager... An excited smile from Jack at the sight of Cash...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then...the color drains from JackВ’s face... JACK (CONTВ’D) What are you doing here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack moves toward Cash at the counter... JACK (CONTВ’D) YouВ’re not sending me  back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl eyes Jack curiously, then removes a dollar  bill from her pocket and slides it across the counter  to Cash...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, itВ’s good to see  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash reaches into the register, taking out change for  ten dollars...he hands the girl $9.35... CASH (CONTВ’D) (to the girl) Thank you darlinВ’...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl looks at the money, realizing that Cash has  given her the wrong change... CASH (CONTВ’D) (back to Jack,  seeing the rock salt) What do you got there,  rock salt?  Look at you,  all domestic and shit... You really figured some  things out, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl looks at Cash talking to Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m not going back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl hesitates...Cash turns to her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the girl) Everything okay...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, a moment of decision, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising his voice) Hey! Did you hear me...?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash ignores Jack, watching the girl as she heads to  the door, hesitates a moment, then walks out... A look of disappointment on CashВ’s face as he reaches  into his pocket, pulling out a little notebook... Cash looks at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making a note  in his book) That was a character issue... (shaking his head) ...and for nine dollars?   ThatВ’s just sad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, IВ’m talking to you!   I am not going back, do you  understand...?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash looks at him, compassion on his face. JACK (CONTВ’D) You canВ’t do this. You  canВ’t keep coming in and  out of peopleВ’s lives,  messing things up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CВ’mon, Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack throws six bucks on the counter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’ve got kids, IВ’m going  home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what the word  glimpse means, J? ItВ’s  by nature an impermanent  thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks determinedly toward the exit. He stops and  turns at the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at  Cash) IВ’m staying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash follows him with his eyes, a proud look on CashВ’s  face as Jack leaves... 111        INT. CAMPBELL HOUSE, JOSHВ’S ROOM - LATE NIGHT Jack walks to Josh.  HeВ’s sleeping soundly. Jack gently kisses Josh on the head, careful not to  wake him. 112        INT. CAMPBELL HOUSE, ANNIEВ’S ROOM - LATE NIGH Jack is standing over Annie, kissing her on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stirring, groggy) Is it morning yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, honey. Go back to  sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes as Jack stands there for a moment  looking at her, sadness all over his face. JACK (CONTВ’D) Take care of yourself, Annie.  IВ’m going back to  the mother ship...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, he turns to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock reads, В“11:17.В”  Kate is already in bed as  Jack walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up from  her book) Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack approaches her, sitting on the bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These last weeks, Kate, I  know that IВ’ve done  some...some unusual  things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s been interesting,  thatВ’s for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But IВ’ve done some good  things too, havenВ’t I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YouВ’ve been Jack  Campbell.  And thatВ’s  always a good thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him on the cheek. He takes her arms in his hands and looks her in the  eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to remember  me, Kate.  How I am right  now, right this very  moment.  I need you to  put that image in your  heart and keep it with  you, no matter what  happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, just promise me  youВ’ll do that. You have  to promise, Kate.  Because if you donВ’t,  then itВ’s like it never  happened and I donВ’t  think I could live with  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SheВ’s a bit confused but she couldnВ’t be more in love  with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise, Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise. Come to bed,  honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stands up, heading toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow begins to fall... Jack with Lucy on a leash, walking side by side, his  mind elsewhere... Lucy leads him around a corner...to a large open  field... Lucy stops.  She looks back at Jack, then out to the  open field. Jack removes the leash. The dog bounds happily out  into the field, looking for just the right spot. Jack puts his hands in his coat pocket...pulls out a  half-eaten roll of PEPPERMINT LIFESAVERS, puts one in  his mouth... He looks up at the sky, snow gently falling onto his  face. ItВ’s cold, but itВ’s beautiful...peaceful and  still...the air clean and crisp... He breathes in the fresh air, the Lifesaver dissolving  in his mouth, watching the dog...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark... Jack enters, sees Kate sleeping soundly in bed. He sits down in a chair and watches Kate asleep, a sad  look in his eyes... As he continues to watch her, to listen to her, his own  eyelids appear to grow heavy... He tries to fight the sleep...opening his eyes... focusing on her...but itВ’s no use... Finally, he closes his eyes...falling into a deep  sleep...

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: 116        INT. JACKВ’S APARTMENT, BEDROOM - MORNING

dialogues.speaker: A PHONE RINGING
dialogues.text: Jack, flat on his back in bed...Light streams onto  his face ...he stirs... THE PHONE STILL RINGING... Jack reaches over to KateВ’s side...thereВ’s no one  there. Pull back to reveal...his old Manhattan apartment...  his old dressy clothes strewn on the floor... Jack, sleep still in his eyes, reaches over...heВ’s not  wearing any pajamas...picks up the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy, dazed) Yeah...okay, send her  up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops the phone...turns back over...letВ’s his eyes  stay closed for another moment...then... His eyes open... He looks around...sees his shirtless torso...then his  old apartment...tailored clothes on the floor. JACK (CONTВ’D) (sadly) Damnit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at the clock, В“9:23 a.m.В”  He gets out of  bed, throwing on pants and a pair of shoes, and leaves  the room... 117        INT. JACKВ’S APARTMENT, LIVING ROOM - CONTINUO ...Jack walks to the door just as... The doorbell RINGS.  He stops, then cautiously opens  the door, seeing... PAULA, wearing a long overcoat and a wide smile on her  face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for me by the door,  huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula opens her coat В– the only thing she has on  underneath is a sexy little teddy. JACK (CONTВ’D) (momentarily  distracted) ThatВ’s totally see through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Merry Christmas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Christmas?  It canВ’t be  Christmas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stares at her, totally confused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lasciviously) ItВ’s whatever you want it  to be, Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack grabs a leather jacket then walks right by a  shocked Paula and heads out the door, practically  running down the corridor. PAULA (CONTВ’D)                         Jack?...Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s Ferrari speeds down the bridge, toward Jersey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s Ferrari pulls up in the driveway and he hops  out. He races to the front door, POUNDING on it... A MAN in a Van Heusen shirt and Hagar slacks answers.   Jack stares at him in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Kate here? Does Kate live  here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate? No, thereВ’s no one here  named Kate.  Is that good  enough for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack starts rapping his head against the door post,  much to the shock of the guy standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn...damn...damn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...IВ’m not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything I can do  for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack shakes his head mournfully. MAN (CONTВ’D) Hey, my wifeВ’s in the kitchen.   You got a cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m sorry, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks off, beleaguered... 120        EXT. ARNIEВ’S HOUSE - MINUTES LATER JackВ’s car drives by as Arnie carries a bicycle box out to the garbage.  The car screeches to a halt in front  of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting at Jack) Hey, you canВ’t park that  thing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out the window) ItВ’s me, Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I donВ’t care if youВ’re Tim  Allen with your fancy car  and all your tools, you  still canВ’t park here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you recognize me,  Arnie.  Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HowВ’d you know my name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We bowl together. WeВ’re  bowlers ...we won a  championship...weВ’re winners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never won anything in  bowling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnie peers at Jack through the window. ARNIE (CONTВ’D) Wait a second... (thinking) Jack...Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...Jack Campbell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Jack Campbell. I  went to high school with you...you played baseball,  right? (at the Ferrari) YouВ’re doing well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembering) Yes, thatВ’s it...yes, we  went to high school together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never really talked to  me.  I wanted to talk to  you, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...I guess I just  wanted you to know, we  couldВ’ve been really good  friends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack driving...a CELL PHONE RINGS. A curious look on JackВ’s face, itВ’s been a while since  heВ’s heard that sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering phone)  Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Santa, where are you?   EverybodyВ’s here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adelle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were supposed to be here  half an hour ago...the  emergency strategy session?   Your trip to Aspen? TheyВ’re  all panicked here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence from Jack... ADELLE (CONTВ’D, O.S.) Jack...? Are you going through  the tunnel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Jack shakes his head, defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’ll be there in twenty  minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s a beehive of activity... JackВ’s TEAM, anxiously going over reports and flow  charts, working the phones, drinking coffee... Jack enters, still reeling from his experience, taking  a moment to observe the action... Mintz spots him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Thank god, JackВ’s here. IВ’ll  call you right back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up the phone as all eyes in the room turn to  Jack, immediately fixating on how disheveled he looks. ALAN (CONTВ’D) (approaching) Jack, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a daze) WhatВ’s going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s not good.  Bob Thomas  has secretly been talking to  a European drug company.   WeВ’re not sure which one,  JuliaВ’s on it right now.   Word is theyВ’re willing to  let him buy a minority stake  and keep running the entire  company.  The Global people  are up in arms.  They say  we shouldВ’ve been prepared  for this.  WeВ’re in trouble  here, Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at Alan for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know something, Alan.   ThereВ’s a much more assertive  person somewhere inside of  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan looks at him, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I think I like you better  this way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this another one of those  Sun Tzu В“Art of WarВ” tricks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sad laugh from Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are we gonna do,  Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack wallows for another moment in his own sadness... ALAN (CONTВ’D) Jack...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack snaps out of it, turning to Alan and the rest of  the group...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’ll tell you exactly what  weВ’re going to do.  YouВ’re going to do whatever you  have to do to find out which  European company heВ’s been  talking to.  Then IВ’m going  to clean myself up, fly to  Aspen, and drink egg nog  with Bob Thomas.  His wife  and kids will be playing in  the background while I spend  Christmas day convincing him  that the European company is  the devil and Global is the  answer to his prayers, after  all... (growing wistful) Then IВ’m going to spend four  hours skiing. Alone. On  Christmas day. Completely  and utterly alone. IВ’m going  to do that because that is  my life, that is whatВ’s  real, and there is nothing  I can do to change that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack leaves the office to the shocked stares of his  team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s limo makes its way downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack in the back seat of the limo, sadly looking out  the window, watching the buildings pass by... He turns away, looks at the phone...haltingly picks it  up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dialing 411) For Manhattan...Kate  Reynolds...I need an address  too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack jots something down on a business card.  Then he  hangs up the phone, thinks a moment, looks out the  window, then turns to the driver... JACK (CONTВ’D) Make a right here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the airportВ’s the other way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WeВ’re not going to the  airport...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 123A        EXT. KATEВ’S BUILDING - DAY JackВ’s limo pulls up outside this house on Washington  Mews... Jack gets out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stands outside an apartment door.  He hears The  ClashВ’s В“London CallingВ” BLARING from inside. He rings the bell...the volume of the music gets  lower... KateВ’s assistant, LORI, 20s, opens the door...Jack  exchanges a curious look with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you from the shipping  company?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m Jack Campbell...IВ’m an  old... friend of KateВ’s.   I just called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman looks at him, then walks back inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate! Some guyВ’s here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Jack waits anxiously at the door. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lori) Did you call the airline  like I asked?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s eyes come alive as Kate appears wearing jeans  and a white blouse...except for her hair, she looks the  same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack...God, itВ’s been so  long...You look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She searches for a kind word, but he looks terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s good to see you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him another moment, then turns... KATE (CONTВ’D) (yelling inside) Lori! WhereВ’s that box?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate walks inside, Jack follows her in sheepishly. 125        INT. KATEВ’S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS ...Jack accidentally knocks into a stack of boxes,  sending a GLASS CANDY DISH CRASHING to the floor,  SHATTERING it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bending down) I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DonВ’t worry about it, Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks up at...a beehive of activity В– Lori on the  phone, boxes stacked everywhere, TWO MOVERS packing  up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WhatВ’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (searching around) IВ’m moving to Paris...it was  right here... (to Lori) ItВ’s a box marked В“Jack.В”  I  put it in the stack for the  Salvation Army...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate, with  attitude) Do you want me to look for  the box or call the airline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, kind of under a little  pressure here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, kind of giving up  Christmas day for my ex-boss  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack watches this back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didnВ’t seem to mind  offering to help me on  Christmas day when you were  unwrapping that Prada bag  I gave you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe itВ’s by the wardrobe  boxes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate heads over to some tall wardrobe boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YouВ’re moving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. To Paris. My firm  has an office there and  IВ’m going to be heading  it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) To Paris. Paris, France.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (searching the  boxes) ThatВ’s the one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So youВ’re not at a non- profit firm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a chuckle) Not with what they pay me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YouВ’re not married, are  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Jack, I never got  married. You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly... (looking around) Can we just take a minute  here?  Maybe get a cup of  coffee or something...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) IВ’ll go for a cup of coffee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A relieved smile from Jack... KATE (CONTВ’D) I found it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. The La  Guardia flightВ’s canceled  but I got you out of  Kennedy on United at nine.   Am I good or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s smile disappears as Kate hands him a sealed box  marked, В“JackВ”...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go.  ItВ’s just  some old things of yours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stands here, looking at the box, then at Kate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever think about us,  Kate?  About what might  have happened...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bemused LAUGH from Kate.  Then she sees heВ’s not  laughing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YouВ’re serious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nod from Jack... KATE (CONTВ’D) IВ’ll tell you what, Jack,  if youВ’re ever in Paris,  look me up. Maybe weВ’ll  go for that cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the movers passes by Jack carrying a box... Jack looks at Kate, flush with the realization that  this isnВ’t the same woman he knew thirteen years  ago, or left yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Goodbye, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 126        INT. JACKВ’S APARTMENT - EVENING A scratchy Zeppelin album, the song В“All Of My Love,В”  fills the room. Jack, a fifth of BushmillВ’s by his  side, goes through the box Kate gave him. He removes a worn leather jacket, feeling the soft  material, then a В“Mondale for PresidentВ” button, which  Jack smiles upon seeing, a couple Neil Young concert ticket stubs... He puts the leather jacket on, then sticks the Mondale  button on the lapel.  He digs back into the box,  finding... A messy, dog-eared copy of В“CatВ’s CradleВ”...not the on Kate gave him at the airport, the one she replaced... Jack looks at it for a moment...lost in his sadness...  then... He looks over at the clock, it reads, В“8:29.В”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack in his Ferrari, racing down the highway at 120  MPH... He looks at the clock, it reads, В“8:46.В” He opens up  the throttle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow is falling as JackВ’s car races up to the terminal  then stops. He jumps out. An AIRPORT SECURITY GUARD  sees him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you canВ’t leave that  there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack runs into the terminal, ignoring the guard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looking at the board. The nine oВ’clock to Paris -  Gate 8A. Jack sprints toward the gate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and gets there just as the flight is boarding. Jack looks through the crowd, spotting Kate near the  front of the line, about to hand her ticket to the gate  attendant. He pushes through the throng of people, drawing some  annoyed stares, finally making his way over to Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Kate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate turns and sees Jack, a look of puzzlement on her  face. JACK (CONTВ’D) You canВ’t go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DonВ’t get on that plane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. LetВ’s just go have  a cup of coffee. ThatВ’s all  IВ’m asking for. IВ’m sure  thereВ’s another flight to  Paris tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me?  You want me to tell you  everything that happened  was okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack just stands there, unsure... KATE (CONTВ’D) Well it is. Yes, I was  heartbroken ...But I got  over it. I moved on.  People change, Jack. I  changed. I donВ’t know  why you suddenly feel the  need to revisit that time  in our lives but I assure  you, itВ’s over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate turns her back to Jack, leaving him standing  there... He watches her walk to the podium, realizing sheВ’s  right... He sees Kate reach the podium...hand her ticket to the  attendant... Finally, a look of determination crosses his face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at Kate) We have a house in Jersey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate turns to him with a look that could kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DonВ’t do this, Jack... But he continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have two kids, Annie and  Josh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Kate looks at him, half-mortified, half- interested... JACK (CONTВ’D) ...AnnieВ’s not much of a  violin player but she  tries really hard. SheВ’s a  little precocious but thatВ’s  only because she says whatВ’s  on her mind. And when she  smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack shakes his head, remembering, fighting back the  tears... JACK (CONTВ’D) And Josh...he has your eyes.  He doesnВ’t say much but we  know heВ’s smart... (lost in the memory) ...heВ’s always got his eyes  open, always watching us... sometimes you can look at  him and just know that heВ’s  learning something new... itВ’s like witnessing a  miracle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KateВ’s expression has sifted from annoyance to  curiosity. JACK (CONTВ’D) ...the house is a mess, but  itВ’s ours... (chuckling) ...well, after a hundred  twenty two more payments  it will be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack begins walking slowly toward Kate...the world of  the airport going on around him, Jack not caring... JACK (CONTВ’D) And you...youВ’re a non- profit lawyer. ThatВ’s right,  completely non-profit. But  that doesnВ’t seem to bother  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate raises an eyebrow. ItВ’s something sheВ’s thought  about. JACK (CONTВ’D) And weВ’re in love. After  thirteen years of marriage  weВ’re still unbelievably  in love... (with a chuckle) You wonВ’t even let me touch  you until IВ’ve said it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack gets closer and closer...KateВ’s spellbound now...  imagining the picture JackВ’s painting... JACK (CONTВ’D) ...I sing to you...not all  the time but definitely on  special occasions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks into a piece of carry-on luggage sitting by a  row of passengers... JACK (CONTВ’D) (off hand, to passenger) Excuse me... (to Kate) We made a lot of sacrifices,  dealt with our share of  surprises, but we stayed  together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s nearly there... JACK (CONTВ’D) You see, youВ’re a better  person than I am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in this life, and Kate knows it... JACK (CONTВ’D) ...and it made me a better  person to be around you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is perfectly still, JackВ’s words echoing in her  ears. JACK (CONTВ’D) Maybe it was all a  dream. Maybe I went to  bed one lonely night in  December and imagined it  all. But I swear,  nothingВ’s ever felt more  real to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HeВ’s right in front of her. She canВ’t take her eyes  off him. JACK (CONTВ’D) And if you get on that  plane right now, itВ’ll  disappear forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Jack and Kate in their own little  world...airport business going on around them... JACK (CONTВ’D) I know we can both go on  with our lives. And weВ’d  both be fine. But IВ’ve  seen what we can be like  together...And I choose  us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JackВ’s words resonate in her ears. He gently touches a  hand to her arm... JACK (CONTВ’D) Please, Kate, one cup of  coffee. You can always go  to Paris. Just please, not  tonight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands there, frozen, staring into JackВ’s eyes,  searching for the answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Kate, framed in the window of a nearly empty  airport coffee shop...through the window, we see snow  falling outside. From a distance we see them...TALKING and LAUGHING over  a cup of coffee... FADE OUT.
